content: 'Cloud Infrastructure Security Subnet - Mechanisms exist to host security-specific technologies in a dedicated subnet.; Domain: Cloud Security; Questions: Does the organization host security-specific technologies in a dedicated subnet?'

label: CLD-04
content: 'Application & Program Interface (API) Security - Mechanisms exist to ensure support for secure interoperability between components with Application & Program Interfaces (APIs).; Domain: Cloud Security; Questions: Does the organization ensure support for secure interoperability between components with Application & Program Interfaces (APIs)?'

label: CLD-05
content: 'Virtual Machine Images - Mechanisms exist to ensure the integrity of virtual machine images at all times.; Domain: Cloud Security; Questions: Does the organization ensure the integrity of virtual machine images at all times?'

label: CLD-06
content: 'Multi-Tenant Environments - Mechanisms exist to ensure multi-tenant owned or managed assets (physical and virtual) are designed and governed such that provider and customer (tenant) user access is appropriately segmented from other tenant users.; Domain: Cloud Security; Questions: Does the organization ensure multi-tenant owned or managed assets (physical and virtual) are designed and governed such that provider and customer (tenant) user access is appropriately segmented from other tenant users?'

label: CLD-06.1
content: 'Customer Responsibility Matrix (CRM) - Mechanisms exist to formally document a Customer Responsibility Matrix (CRM), delineating assigned responsibilities for controls between the Cloud Service Provider (CSP) and its customers.; Domain: Cloud Security; Questions: Does the organization formally document a Customer Responsibility Matrix (CRM), delineating assigned responsibilities for controls between the Cloud Service Provider (CSP) and its customers?'

label: CLD-06.2
content: 'Multi-Tenant Event Logging Capabilities - Mechanisms exist to ensure Multi-Tenant Service Providers (MTSP) facilitate security event logging capabilities for its customers that are consistent with applicable statutory, regulatory and/or contractual obligations.; Domain: Cloud Security; Questions: Does the organization ensure Multi-Tenant Service Providers (MTSP) facilitate security event logging capabilities for its customers that are consistent with applicable statutory, regulatory and/or contractual obligations?'

label: CLD-06.3
content: 'Multi-Tenant Forensics Capabilities - Mechanisms exist to ensure Multi-Tenant Service Providers (MTSP) facilitate prompt forensic investigations in the event of a suspected or confirmed security incident.; Domain: Cloud Security; Questions: Does the organization ensure Multi-Tenant Service Providers (MTSP) facilitate prompt forensic investigations in the event of a suspected or confirmed security incident?'

label: CLD-06.4
content: 'Multi-Tenant Incident Response Capabilities - Mechanisms exist to ensure Multi-Tenant Service Providers (MTSP) facilitate prompt response to suspected or confirmed security incidents and vulnerabilities, including timely notification to affected customers.; Domain: Cloud Security; Questions: Does the organization ensure Multi-Tenant Service Providers (MTSP) facilitate prompt response to suspected or confirmed security incidents and vulnerabilities, including timely notification to affected customers?'

label: CLD-07
content: 'Data Handling & Portability - Mechanisms exist to ensure cloud providers use secure protocols for the import, export and management of data in cloud-based services.; Domain: Cloud Security; Questions: Does the organization ensure cloud providers use secure protocols for the import, export and management of data in cloud-based services?'

label: CLD-08
content: 'Standardized Virtualization Formats - Mechanisms exist to ensure interoperability by requiring cloud providers to use industry-recognized formats and provide documentation of custom changes for review.; Domain: Cloud Security; Questions: Does the organization ensure interoperability by requiring cloud providers to use industry-recognized formats and provide documentation of custom changes for review?'

label: CLD-09
content: 'Geolocation Requirements for Processing, Storage and Service Locations - Mechanisms exist to control the location of cloud processing/storage based on business requirements that includes statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations.; Domain: Cloud Security; Questions: Does the organization control the location of cloud processing/storage based on business requirements that includes statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations?'

label: CLD-10
content: 'Sensitive Data In Public Cloud Providers - Mechanisms exist to limit and manage the storage of sensitive/regulated data in public cloud providers.; Domain: Cloud Security; Questions: Does the organization limit and manage the storage of sensitive/regulated data in public cloud providers?'

label: CLD-11
content: 'Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB) - Mechanisms exist to utilize a Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB), or similar technology, to provide boundary protection and monitoring functions that both provide access to the cloud and protect the organization from misuse of cloud resources.; Domain: Cloud Security; Questions: Does the organization utilize a Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB), or similar technology, to provide boundary protection and monitoring functions that both provide access to the cloud and protect the organization from misuse of cloud resources?'

label: CLD-12
content: 'Side Channel Attack Prevention - Mechanisms exist to prevent "side channel attacks" when using a Content Delivery Network (CDN) by restricting access to the origin server's IP address to the CDN and an authorized management network.; Domain: Cloud Security; Questions: Does the organization prevent "side channel attacks" when using a Content Delivery Network (CDN) by restricting access to the origin server's IP address to the CDN and an authorized management network?'

label: CLD-13
content: 'Hosted Systems, Applications & Services - Mechanisms exist to specify applicable cybersecurity & data protection controls that must be implemented on external systems, consistent with the contractual obligations established with the External Service Providers (ESP) owning, operating and/or maintaining external systems, applications and/or services.; Domain: Cloud Security; Questions: Does the organization specify applicable cybersecurity & data protection controls that must be implemented on external systems, consistent with the contractual obligations established with the External Service Providers (ESP) owning, operating and/or maintaining external systems, applications and/or services?'

label: CLD-13.1
content: 'Authorized Individuals For Hosted Systems, Applications & Services - Mechanisms exist to authorize specified individuals to access External Service Providers (ESP) owned, operated and/or maintained external systems, applications and/or services.; Domain: Cloud Security; Questions: Does the organization authorize specified individuals to access External Service Providers (ESP) owned, operated and/or maintained external systems, applications and/or services?'

label: CLD-13.2
content: 'Sensitive/Regulated Data On Hosted Systems, Applications & Services - Mechanisms exist to define formal processes to store, process and/or transmit sensitive/regulated data using External Service Providers (ESP) owned, operated and/or maintained external systems, applications and/or services , in accordance with all applicable statutory, regulatory and/or contractual obligations.; Domain: Cloud Security; Questions: Does the organization define formal processes to store, process and/or transmit sensitive/regulated data using External Service Providers (ESP) owned, operated and/or maintained external systems, applications and/or services , in accordance with all applicable statutory, regulatory and/or contractual obligations?'

label: CLD-14
content: 'Prohibition On Unverified Hosted Systems, Applications & Services - Mechanisms exist to prohibit access to, or usage of, hosted systems, applications and/or services until applicable cybersecurity & data protection control implementation is verified.; Domain: Cloud Security; Questions: Does the organization prohibit access to, or usage of, hosted systems, applications and/or services until applicable cybersecurity & data protection control implementation is verified?'

label: CPL-01
content: 'Statutory, Regulatory & Contractual Compliance - Mechanisms exist to facilitate the identification and implementation of relevant statutory, regulatory and contractual controls.; Domain: Compliance; Questions: Does the organization facilitate the identification and implementation of relevant statutory, regulatory and contractual controls?'

label: CPL-01.1
content: 'Non-Compliance Oversight - Mechanisms exist to document and review instances of non-compliance with statutory, regulatory and/or contractual obligations to develop appropriate risk mitigation actions.; Domain: Compliance; Questions: Does the organization document and review instances of non-compliance with statutory, regulatory and/or contractual obligations to develop appropriate risk mitigation actions?'

label: CPL-01.2
content: 'Compliance Scope - Mechanisms exist to document and validate the scope of cybersecurity & data privacy controls that are determined to meet statutory, regulatory and/or contractual compliance obligations.; Domain: Compliance; Questions: Does the organization document and validate the scope of cybersecurity & data privacy controls that are determined to meet statutory, regulatory and/or contractual compliance obligations?'

label: CPL-01.3
content: 'Ability To Demonstrate Conformity - Mechanisms exist to ensure the organization is able to demonstrate conformity with applicable cybersecurity and data protection laws, regulations and/or contractual obligations.; Domain: Compliance; Questions: Does the organization ensure it is able to demonstrate conformity with applicable cybersecurity and data protection laws, regulations and/or contractual obligations?'

label: CPL-02
content: 'Cybersecurity & Data Protection Controls Oversight - Mechanisms exist to provide a cybersecurity & data protection controls oversight function that reports to the organization's executive leadership.; Domain: Compliance; Questions: Does the organization provide a cybersecurity & data protection controls oversight function that reports to its executive leadership?'

label: CPL-02.1
content: 'Internal Audit Function - Mechanisms exist to implement an internal audit function that is capable of providing senior organization management with insights into the appropriateness of the organization's technology and information governance processes.; Domain: Compliance; Questions: Does the organization implement an internal audit function that is capable of providing senior organization management with insights into the appropriateness of its technology and information governance processes?'

label: CPL-02.2
content: 'Periodic Audits - Mechanisms exist to conduct periodic audits of cybersecurity & data protection controls to evaluate conformity with the organization's documented policies, standards and procedures.; Domain: Compliance; Questions: Does the organization conduct periodic audits of cybersecurity & data protection controls to evaluate conformity with its documented policies, standards and procedures?'

label: CPL-03
content: 'Cybersecurity & Data Protection Assessments - Mechanisms exist to ensure managers regularly review the processes and documented procedures within their area of responsibility to adhere to appropriate cybersecurity & data protection policies, standards and other applicable requirements.; Domain: Compliance; Questions: Does the organization ensure managers regularly review the processes and documented procedures within their area of responsibility to adhere to appropriate cybersecurity & data protection policies, standards and other applicable requirements?'

label: CPL-03.1
content: 'Independent Assessors - Mechanisms exist to utilize independent assessors to evaluate cybersecurity & data protection controls at planned intervals or when the system, service or project undergoes significant changes.; Domain: Compliance; Questions: Does the organization utilize independent assessors to evaluate cybersecurity & data protection controls at planned intervals or when the system, service or project undergoes significant changes?'

label: CPL-03.2
content: 'Functional Review Of Cybersecurity & Data Protection Controls - Mechanisms exist to regularly review technology assets for adherence to the organization's cybersecurity & data protection policies and standards.; Domain: Compliance; Questions: Does the organization regularly review technology assets for adherence to its cybersecurity & data protection policies and standards?'

label: CPL-04
content: 'Audit Activities - Mechanisms exist to thoughtfully plan audits by including input from operational risk and compliance partners to minimize the impact of audit-related activities on business operations.; Domain: Compliance; Questions: Does the organization thoughtfully plan audits by including input from operational risk and compliance partners to minimize the impact of audit-related activities on business operations?'

label: CPL-05
content: 'Legal Assessment of Investigative Inquires - Mechanisms exist to determine whether a government agency has an applicable and valid legal basis to request data from the organization and what further steps need to be taken, if necessary.; Domain: Compliance; Questions: Does the organization determine whether a government agency has an applicable and valid legal basis to request data from the organization and what further steps need to be taken, if necessary?'

label: CPL-05.1
content: 'Investigation Request Notifications - Mechanisms exist to notify customers about investigation request notifications, unless the applicable legal basis for a government agency's action prohibits notification (e.g., potential criminal prosecution).; Domain: Compliance; Questions: Does the organization notify customers about investigation request notifications, unless the applicable legal basis for a government agency's action prohibits notification (e.g., potential criminal prosecution)?'

label: CPL-05.2
content: 'Investigation Access Restrictions - Mechanisms exist to support official investigations by provisioning government investigators with "least privileges" and "least functionality" to ensure that government investigators only have access to the data and systems needed to perform the investigation.; Domain: Compliance; Questions: Does the organization support official investigations by provisioning government investigators with "least privileges" and "least functionality" to ensure that government investigators only have access to the data and systems needed to perform the investigation?'

label: CPL-06
content: 'Government Surveillance - Mechanisms exist to constrain the host government from having unrestricted and non-monitored access to the organization's systems, applications and services that could potentially violate other applicable statutory, regulatory and/or contractual obligations.; Domain: Compliance; Questions: Does the organization constrain the host government from having unrestricted and non-monitored access to its systems, applications and services that could potentially violate other applicable statutory, regulatory and/or contractual obligations?'

label: CPL-07
content: 'Grievances - Mechanisms exist to govern the intake and analysis of grievances related to the organization's cybersecurity and/or data protection practices.; Domain: Compliance; Questions: Does the organization govern the intake, analysis, assignment and remediation of grievances related to its cybersecurity and/or data protection practices?'

label: CPL-07.1
content: 'Grievance Response - Mechanisms exist to respond to legitimate grievances related to the organization's cybersecurity and/or data protection practices.; Domain: Compliance; Questions: Does the organization respond to legitimate grievances related to its cybersecurity and/or data protection practices?'

label: CRY-01
content: 'Use of Cryptographic Controls - Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of cryptographic protections controls using known public standards and trusted cryptographic technologies.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Does the organization facilitate the implementation of cryptographic protections controls using known public standards and trusted cryptographic technologies?'

label: CRY-01.1
content: 'Alternate Physical Protection - Cryptographic mechanisms exist to prevent unauthorized disclosure of information as an alternative to physical safeguards.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Are cryptographic mechanisms utilized to prevent unauthorized disclosure of information as an alternative to physical safeguards?'

label: CRY-01.2
content: 'Export-Controlled Cryptography - Mechanisms exist to address the exporting of cryptographic technologies in compliance with relevant statutory and regulatory requirements.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Does the organization address the exporting of cryptographic technologies in compliance with relevant statutory and regulatory requirements?'

label: CRY-01.3
content: 'Pre/Post Transmission Handling - Cryptographic mechanisms exist to ensure the confidentiality and integrity of information during preparation for transmission and during reception.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Are cryptographic mechanisms utilized to ensure the confidentiality and integrity of information during preparation for transmission and during reception?'

label: CRY-01.4
content: 'Conceal / Randomize Communications - Cryptographic mechanisms exist to conceal or randomize communication patterns.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Are cryptographic mechanisms utilized to conceal or randomize communication patterns?'

label: CRY-01.5
content: 'Cryptographic Cipher Suites and Protocols Inventory - Mechanisms exist to identify, document and review deployed cryptographic cipher suites and protocols to proactively respond to industry trends regarding the continued viability of utilized cryptographic cipher suites and protocols.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Does the organization identify, document and review deployed cryptographic cipher suites and protocols to proactively respond to industry trends regarding the continued viability of utilized cryptographic cipher suites and protocols?'

label: CRY-02
content: 'Cryptographic Module Authentication - Automated mechanisms exist to enable systems to authenticate to a cryptographic module.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to enable systems to authenticate to a cryptographic module?'

label: CRY-03
content: 'Transmission Confidentiality - Cryptographic mechanisms exist to protect the confidentiality of data being transmitted.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Are cryptographic mechanisms utilized to protect the confidentiality of data being transmitted?'

label: CRY-04
content: 'Transmission Integrity - Cryptographic mechanisms exist to protect the integrity of data being transmitted.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Are cryptographic mechanisms utilized to protect the integrity of data being transmitted?'

label: CRY-05
content: 'Encrypting Data At Rest - Cryptographic mechanisms exist to prevent unauthorized disclosure of data at rest.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Are cryptographic mechanisms utilized to prevent unauthorized disclosure of data at rest?'

label: CRY-05.1
content: 'Storage Media - Cryptographic mechanisms exist to protect the confidentiality and integrity of sensitive/regulated data residing on storage media.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Are cryptographic mechanisms utilized to protect the confidentiality and integrity of sensitive/regulated data residing on storage media?'

label: CRY-05.2
content: 'Offline Storage - Mechanisms exist to remove unused data from online storage and archive it off-line in a secure location until it can be disposed of according to data retention requirements.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Does the organization remove unused data from online storage and archive it off-line in a secure location until it can be disposed of according to data retention requirements?'

label: CRY-05.3
content: 'Database Encryption - Mechanisms exist to ensure that database servers utilize encryption to protect the confidentiality of the data within the databases.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Does the organization ensure that database servers utilize encryption to protect the confidentiality of the data within the databases?'

label: CRY-06
content: 'Non-Console Administrative Access - Cryptographic mechanisms exist to protect the confidentiality and integrity of non-console administrative access.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Are cryptographic mechanisms utilized to protect the confidentiality and integrity of non-console administrative access?'

label: CRY-07
content: 'Wireless Access Authentication & Encryption - Mechanisms exist to protect the confidentiality and integrity of wireless networking technologies by implementing authentication and strong encryption.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Does the organization protect the confidentiality and integrity of wireless networking technologies by implementing authentication and strong encryption?'

label: CRY-08
content: 'Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) - Mechanisms exist to securely implement an internal Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) infrastructure or obtain PKI services from a reputable PKI service provider.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Does the organization securely implement an internal Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) infrastructure or obtain PKI services from a reputable PKI service provider?'

label: CRY-08.1
content: 'Availability - Resiliency mechanisms exist to ensure the availability of data in the event of the loss of cryptographic keys.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Does the organization ensure the availability of data in the event of the loss of cryptographic keys?'

label: CRY-09
content: 'Cryptographic Key Management - Mechanisms exist to facilitate cryptographic key management controls to protect the confidentiality, integrity and availability of keys.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Does the organization facilitate cryptographic key management controls to protect the confidentiality, integrity and availability of keys?'

label: CRY-09.1
content: 'Symmetric Keys - Mechanisms exist to facilitate the production and management of symmetric cryptographic keys using Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS)-compliant key management technology and processes.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Does the organization facilitate the production and management of symmetric cryptographic keys using Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS)-compliant key management technology and processes?'

label: CRY-09.2
content: 'Asymmetric Keys - Mechanisms exist to facilitate the production and management of asymmetric cryptographic keys using Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS)-compliant key management technology and processes that protect the user’s private key.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Does the organization facilitate the production and management of asymmetric cryptographic keys using Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS)-compliant key management technology and processes that protect the user’s private key?'

label: CRY-09.3
content: 'Cryptographic Key Loss or Change - Mechanisms exist to ensure the availability of information in the event of the loss of cryptographic keys by individual users.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Does the organization ensure the availability of information in the event of the loss of cryptographic keys by individual users?'

label: CRY-09.4
content: 'Control & Distribution of Cryptographic Keys - Mechanisms exist to facilitate the secure distribution of symmetric and asymmetric cryptographic keys using industry recognized key management technology and processes.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Does the organization facilitate the secure distribution of symmetric and asymmetric cryptographic keys using industry recognized key management technology and processes?'

label: CRY-09.5
content: 'Assigned Owners - Mechanisms exist to ensure cryptographic keys are bound to individual identities.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Does the organization ensure cryptographic keys are bound to individual identities?'

label: CRY-09.6
content: 'Third-Party Cryptographic Keys - Mechanisms exist to ensure customers are provided with appropriate key management guidance whenever cryptographic keys are shared.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Does the organization ensure customers are provided with appropriate key management guidance whenever cryptographic keys are shared?'

label: CRY-09.7
content: 'External System Cryptographic Key Control - Mechanisms exist to maintain control of cryptographic keys for encrypted material stored or transmitted through an external system.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Does the organization maintain control of cryptographic keys for encrypted material stored or transmitted through an external system?'

label: CRY-10
content: 'Transmission of Cybersecurity & Data Privacy Attributes - Mechanisms exist to ensure systems associate security attributes with information exchanged between systems.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Does the organization ensure systems associate security attributes with information exchanged between systems?'

label: CRY-11
content: 'Certificate Authorities - Automated mechanisms exist to enable the use of organization-defined Certificate Authorities (CAs) to facilitate the establishment of protected sessions.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to enable the use of organization-defined Certificate Authorities (CAs) to facilitate the establishment of protected sessions?'

label: CRY-12
content: 'Certificate Monitoring - Automated mechanisms exist to discover when new certificates are issued for organization-controlled domains.; Domain: Cryptographic Protections; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to discover when new certificates are issued for organization-controlled domains?'

label: DCH-01
content: 'Data Protection - Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of data protection controls.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization facilitate the implementation of data protection controls?'

label: DCH-01.1
content: 'Data Stewardship - Mechanisms exist to ensure data stewardship is assigned, documented and communicated.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization ensure data stewardship is assigned, documented and communicated?'

label: DCH-01.2
content: 'Sensitive / Regulated Data Protection - Mechanisms exist to protect sensitive/regulated data wherever it is stored.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization protect sensitive/regulated data wherever it is stored?'

label: DCH-01.3
content: 'Sensitive / Regulated Media Records - Mechanisms exist to ensure media records for sensitive/regulated data contain sufficient information to determine the potential impact in the event of a data loss incident.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization ensure media records for sensitive/regulated data contain sufficient information to determine the potential impact in the event of a data loss incident?'

label: DCH-01.4
content: 'Defining Access Authorizations for Sensitive/Regulated Data - Mechanisms exist to explicitly define authorizations for specific individuals and/or roles for logical and /or physical access to sensitive/regulated data.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization explicitly define authorizations for specific individuals and/or roles for logical and /or physical access to sensitive/regulated data?'

label: DCH-02
content: 'Data & Asset Classification - Mechanisms exist to ensure data and assets are categorized in accordance with applicable statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization ensure data and assets are categorized in accordance with applicable statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements?'

label: DCH-02.1
content: 'Highest Classification Level - Mechanisms exist to ensure that systems, applications and services are classified according to the highest level of data sensitivity that is stored, transmitted and/or processed.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization ensure that systems, applications and services are classified according to the highest level of data sensitivity that is stored, transmitted and/or processed?'

label: DCH-03
content: 'Media Access - Mechanisms exist to control and restrict access to digital and non-digital media to authorized individuals.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization control and restrict access to digital and non-digital media to authorized individuals?'

label: DCH-03.1
content: 'Disclosure of Information - Mechanisms exist to restrict the disclosure of sensitive / regulated data to authorized parties with a need to know.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization restrict the disclosure of sensitive / regulated data to authorized parties with a need to know?'

label: DCH-03.2
content: 'Masking Displayed Data - Mechanisms exist to apply data masking to sensitive/regulated information that is displayed or printed.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization apply data masking to sensitive/regulated information that is displayed or printed?'

label: DCH-03.3
content: 'Controlled Release - Automated mechanisms exist to validate cybersecurity & data privacy attributes prior to releasing information to external systems.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to validate cybersecurity & data privacy attributes prior to releasing information to external systems?'

label: DCH-04
content: 'Media Marking - Mechanisms exist to mark media in accordance with data protection requirements so that personnel are alerted to distribution limitations, handling caveats and applicable security requirements.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization mark media in accordance with data protection requirements so that personnel are alerted to distribution limitations, handling caveats and applicable security requirements?'

label: DCH-04.1
content: 'Automated Marking - Automated mechanisms exist to mark physical media and digital files to indicate the distribution limitations, handling requirements and applicable security markings (if any) of the information to aid Data Loss Prevention (DLP) technologies.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to mark physical media and digital files to indicate the distribution limitations, handling requirements and applicable security markings (if any) of the information to aid Data Loss Prevention (DLP) technologies?'

label: DCH-05
content: 'Cybersecurity & Data Privacy Attributes - Mechanisms exist to bind cybersecurity & data privacy attributes to information as it is stored, transmitted and processed.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization bind cybersecurity & data privacy attributes to information as it is stored, transmitted and processed?'

label: DCH-05.1
content: 'Dynamic Attribute Association - Mechanisms exist to dynamically associate cybersecurity & data privacy attributes with individuals and objects as information is created, combined, or transformed, in accordance with organization-defined cybersecurity and data privacy policies.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization dynamically associate cybersecurity & data privacy attributes with individuals and objects as information is created, combined, or transformed, in accordance with organization-defined cybersecurity and data privacy policies?'

label: DCH-05.10
content: 'Attribute Configuration By Authorized Individuals - Mechanisms exist to provide authorized individuals the capability to define or change the type and value of cybersecurity & data privacy attributes available for association with subjects and objects.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization provide authorized individuals the capability to define or change the type and value of cybersecurity & data privacy attributes available for association with subjects and objects?'

label: DCH-05.11
content: 'Audit Changes - Mechanisms exist to audit changes to cybersecurity & data privacy attributes and responds to events in accordance with incident response procedures.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization audit changes to cybersecurity & data privacy attributes and responds to events in accordance with incident response procedures?'

label: DCH-05.2
content: 'Attribute Value Changes By Authorized Individuals - Mechanisms exist to provide authorized individuals (or processes acting on behalf of individuals) the capability to define or change the value of associated cybersecurity & data privacy attributes.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization provide authorized individuals (or processes acting on behalf of individuals) the capability to define or change the value of associated cybersecurity & data privacy attributes?'

label: DCH-05.3
content: 'Maintenance of Attribute Associations By System - Mechanisms exist to maintain the association and integrity of cybersecurity & data privacy attributes to individuals and objects.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization maintain the association and integrity of cybersecurity & data privacy attributes to individuals and objects?'

label: DCH-05.4
content: 'Association of Attributes By Authorized Individuals - Mechanisms exist to provide the capability to associate cybersecurity & data privacy attributes with individuals and objects by authorized individuals (or processes acting on behalf of individuals).; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization provide the capability to associate cybersecurity & data privacy attributes with individuals and objects by authorized individuals (or processes acting on behalf of individuals)?'

label: DCH-05.5
content: 'Attribute Displays for Output Devices - Mechanisms exist to display cybersecurity & data privacy attributes in human-readable form on each object that the system transmits to output devices to identify special dissemination, handling or distribution instructions using human-readable, standard naming conventions.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization display cybersecurity & data privacy attributes in human-readable form on each object that the system transmits to output devices to identify special dissemination, handling or distribution instructions using human-readable, standard naming conventions?'

label: DCH-05.6
content: 'Data Subject Attribute Associations - Mechanisms exist to require personnel to associate and maintain the association of cybersecurity & data privacy attributes with individuals and objects in accordance with cybersecurity and data privacy policies.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization require personnel to associate and maintain the association of cybersecurity & data privacy attributes with individuals and objects in accordance with cybersecurity and data privacy policies?'

label: DCH-05.7
content: 'Consistent Attribute Interpretation - Mechanisms exist to provide a consistent, organizationally agreed upon interpretation of cybersecurity & data privacy attributes employed in access enforcement and flow enforcement decisions between distributed system components.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization provide a consistent, organizationally agreed upon interpretation of cybersecurity & data privacy attributes employed in access enforcement and flow enforcement decisions between distributed system components?'

label: DCH-05.8
content: 'Identity Association Techniques & Technologies - Mechanisms exist to associate cybersecurity & data privacy attributes to information.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization associate cybersecurity & data privacy attributes to information?'

label: DCH-05.9
content: 'Attribute Reassignment - Mechanisms exist to reclassify data as required, due to changing business/technical requirements.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization reclassify data as required, due to changing business/technical requirements?'

label: DCH-06
content:
'Media Storage - Mechanisms exist to: 
 (1) Physically control and securely store digital and non-digital media within controlled areas using organization-defined security measures; and
 (2) Protect system media until the media are destroyed or sanitized using approved equipment, techniques and procedures.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization: 
 (1) Physically control and securely store digital and non-digital media within controlled areas using organization-defined security measures; and
 (2) Protect system media until the media are destroyed or sanitized using approved equipment, techniques and procedures?'

label: DCH-06.1
content: 'Physically Secure All Media - Mechanisms exist to physically secure all media that contains sensitive information.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization physically secure all media that contains sensitive information?'

label: DCH-06.2
content: 'Sensitive Data Inventories - Mechanisms exist to maintain inventory logs of all sensitive media and conduct sensitive media inventories at least annually.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization maintain inventory logs of all sensitive media and conduct sensitive media inventories at least annually?'

label: DCH-06.3
content: 'Periodic Scans for Sensitive / Regulated Data - Mechanisms exist to periodically scan unstructured data sources for sensitive/regulated data or data requiring special protection measures by statutory, regulatory or contractual obligations.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization periodically scan unstructured data sources for sensitive/regulated data or data requiring special protection measures by statutory, regulatory or contractual obligations?'

label: DCH-06.4
content: 'Making Sensitive Data Unreadable In Storage - Mechanisms exist to ensure sensitive/regulated data is rendered human unreadable anywhere sensitive/regulated data is stored.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization ensure sensitive/regulated data is rendered human unreadable anywhere sensitive/regulated data is stored?'

label: DCH-06.5
content: 'Storing Authentication Data - Mechanisms exist to prohibit the storage of sensitive transaction authentication data after authorization.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization prohibit the storage of sensitive transaction authentication data after authorization?'

label: DCH-07
content: 'Media Transportation - Mechanisms exist to protect and control digital and non-digital media during transport outside of controlled areas using appropriate security measures.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization protect and control digital and non-digital media during transport outside of controlled areas using appropriate security measures?'

label: DCH-07.1
content: 'Custodians - Mechanisms exist to identify custodians throughout the transport of digital or non-digital media.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization identify custodians throughout the transport of digital or non-digital media?'

label: DCH-07.2
content: 'Encrypting Data In Storage Media - Cryptographic mechanisms exist to protect the confidentiality and integrity of information stored on digital media during transport outside of controlled areas.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Are cryptographic mechanisms utilized to protect the confidentiality and integrity of information stored on digital media during transport outside of controlled areas?'

label: DCH-08
content: 'Physical Media Disposal - Mechanisms exist to securely dispose of media when it is no longer required, using formal procedures.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization securely dispose of media when it is no longer required, using formal procedures?'

label: DCH-09
content: 'System Media Sanitization - Mechanisms exist to sanitize system media with the strength and integrity commensurate with the classification or sensitivity of the information prior to disposal, release out of organizational control or release for reuse.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization sanitize system media with the strength and integrity commensurate with the classification or sensitivity of the information prior to disposal, release out of organizational control or release for reuse?'

label: DCH-09.1
content: 'System Media Sanitization Documentation - Mechanisms exist to supervise, track, document and verify system media sanitization and disposal actions.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization supervise, track, document and verify system media sanitization and disposal actions?'

label: DCH-09.2
content: 'Equipment Testing - Mechanisms exist to test sanitization equipment and procedures to verify that the intended result is achieved.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization test sanitization equipment and procedures to verify that the intended result is achieved?'

label: DCH-09.3
content: 'Sanitization of Personal Data (PD) - Mechanisms exist to facilitate the sanitization of Personal Data (PD).; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization facilitate the sanitization of Personal Data (PD)?'

label: DCH-09.4
content: 'First Time Use Sanitization - Mechanisms exist to apply nondestructive sanitization techniques to portable storage devices prior to first use.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization apply nondestructive sanitization techniques to portable storage devices prior to first use?'

label: DCH-09.5
content: 'Dual Authorization for Sensitive Data Destruction - Mechanisms exist to enforce dual authorization for the destruction, disposal or sanitization of digital media that contains sensitive / regulated data.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization enforce dual authorization for the destruction, disposal or sanitization of digital media that contains sensitive / regulated data?'

label: DCH-10
content: 'Media Use - Mechanisms exist to restrict the use of types of digital media on systems or system components.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization restrict the use of types of digital media on systems or system components?'

label: DCH-10.1
content: 'Limitations on Use - Mechanisms exist to restrict the use and distribution of sensitive / regulated data.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization restrict the use and distribution of sensitive / regulated data?'

label: DCH-10.2
content: 'Prohibit Use Without Owner - Mechanisms exist to prohibit the use of portable storage devices in organizational information systems when such devices have no identifiable owner.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization prohibit the use of portable storage devices in organizational information systems when such devices have no identifiable owner?'

label: DCH-11
content: 'Data Reclassification - Mechanisms exist to reclassify data, including associated systems, applications and services, commensurate with the security category and/or classification level of the information.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization reclassify data, including associated systems, applications and services, commensurate with the security category and/or classification level of the information?'

label: DCH-12
content: 'Removable Media Security - Mechanisms exist to restrict removable media in accordance with data handling and acceptable usage parameters.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization restrict removable media in accordance with data handling and acceptable usage parameters?'

label: DCH-13
content: 'Use of External Information Systems - Mechanisms exist to govern how external parties, systems and services are used to securely store, process and transmit data.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization govern how external parties, systems and services are used to securely store, process and transmit data?'

label: DCH-13.1
content:
'Limits of Authorized Use - Mechanisms exist to prohibit external parties, systems and services from storing, processing and transmitting data unless authorized individuals first: 
 (1) Verifying the implementation of required security controls; or
 (2) Retaining a processing agreement with the entity hosting the external systems or service.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization prohibit external parties, systems and services from storing, processing and transmitting data unless authorized individuals first: 
 (1) Verifying the implementation of required security controls; or
 (2) Retaining a processing agreement with the entity hosting the external systems or service?'

label: DCH-13.2
content: 'Portable Storage Devices - Mechanisms exist to restrict or prohibit the use of portable storage devices by users on external systems.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization restrict or prohibit the use of portable storage devices by users on external systems?'

label: DCH-13.3
content: 'Protecting Sensitive Data on External Systems - Mechanisms exist to ensure that the requirements for the protection of sensitive information processed, stored or transmitted on external systems, are implemented in accordance with applicable statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization ensure that the requirements for the protection of sensitive information processed, stored or transmitted on external systems, are implemented in accordance with applicable statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations?'

label: DCH-13.4
content: 'Non-Organizationally Owned Systems / Components / Devices - Mechanisms exist to restrict the use of non-organizationally owned information systems, system components or devices to process, store or transmit organizational information.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization restrict the use of non-organizationally owned information systems, system components or devices to process, store or transmit organizational information?'

label: DCH-14
content: 'Information Sharing - Mechanisms exist to utilize a process to assist users in making information sharing decisions to ensure data is appropriately protected.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization utilize a process to assist users in making information sharing decisions to ensure data is appropriately protected?'

label: DCH-14.1
content: 'Information Search & Retrieval - Mechanisms exist to ensure information systems implement data search and retrieval functions that properly enforce data protection / sharing restrictions.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization ensure information systems implement data search and retrieval functions that properly enforce data protection / sharing restrictions?'

label: DCH-14.2
content: 'Transfer Authorizations - Mechanisms exist to verify that individuals or systems transferring data between interconnecting systems have the requisite authorizations (e.g., write permissions or privileges) prior to transferring said data.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization verify that individuals or systems transferring data between interconnecting systems have the requisite authorizations (e.g., write permissions or privileges) prior to transferring said data?'

label: DCH-14.3
content: 'Data Access Mapping - Mechanisms exist to leverage data-specific Access Control Lists (ACL) or Interconnection Security Agreements (ISAs) to generate a logical map of the parties with whom sensitive/regulated data is shared.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization leverage data-specific Access Control Lists (ACL) or Interconnection Security Agreements (ISAs) to generate a logical map of the parties with whom sensitive/regulated data is shared?'

label: DCH-15
content: 'Publicly Accessible Content - Mechanisms exist to control publicly-accessible content.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization control publicly-accessible content?'

label: DCH-16
content: 'Data Mining Protection - Mechanisms exist to protect data storage objects against unauthorized data mining and data harvesting techniques.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization protect data storage objects against unauthorized data mining and data harvesting techniques?'

label: DCH-17
content: 'Ad-Hoc Transfers - Mechanisms exist to secure ad-hoc exchanges of large digital files with internal or external parties.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization secure ad-hoc exchanges of large digital files with internal or external parties?'

label: DCH-18
content: 'Media & Data Retention - Mechanisms exist to retain media and data in accordance with applicable statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization retain media and data in accordance with applicable statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations?'

label: DCH-18.1
content: 'Minimize Sensitive / Regulated Data - Mechanisms exist to minimize sensitive/regulated data that is collected, received, processed, stored and/or transmitted throughout the information lifecycle to only those elements necessary to support necessary business processes.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization minimize sensitive/regulated data that is collected, received, processed, stored and/or transmitted throughout the information lifecycle to only those elements necessary to support necessary business processes?'

label: DCH-18.2
content: 'Limit Sensitive / Regulated Data In Testing, Training & Research - Mechanisms exist to minimize the use of sensitive/regulated data for research, testing, or training, in accordance with authorized, legitimate business practices.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization minimize the use of Personal Data (PD) for research, testing, or training, in accordance with the Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA)?'

label: DCH-18.3
content: 'Temporary Files Containing Personal Data (PD) - Mechanisms exist to perform periodic checks of temporary files for the existence of Personal Data (PD).; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization perform periodic checks of temporary files for the existence of Personal Data (PD)?'

label: DCH-19
content: 'Geographic Location of Data - Mechanisms exist to inventory, document and maintain data flows for data that is resident (permanently or temporarily) within a service's geographically distributed applications (physical and virtual), infrastructure, systems components and/or shared with other third-parties.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization inventory, document and maintain data flows for data that is resident (permanently or temporarily) within a service's geographically distributed applications (physical and virtual), infrastructure, systems components and/or shared with other third-parties?'

label: DCH-20
content: 'Archived Data Sets - Mechanisms exist to protect archived data in accordance with applicable statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization protect archived data in accordance with applicable statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations?'

label: DCH-21
content: 'Information Disposal - Mechanisms exist to securely dispose of, destroy or erase information.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization securely dispose of, destroy or erase information?'

label: DCH-22
content: 'Data Quality Operations - Mechanisms exist to check for Redundant, Obsolete/Outdated, Toxic or Trivial (ROTT) data to ensure the accuracy, relevance, timeliness, impact, completeness and de-identification of information throughout the information lifecycle.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization check for Redundant, Obsolete/Outdated, Toxic or Trivial (ROTT) data to ensure the accuracy, relevance, timeliness, impact, completeness and de-identification of information throughout the information lifecycle.'

label: DCH-22.1
content: 'Updating & Correcting Personal Data (PD) - Mechanisms exist to utilize technical controls to correct Personal Data (PD) that is inaccurate or outdated, incorrectly determined regarding impact, or incorrectly de-identified.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization utilize technical controls to correct Personal Data (PD) that is inaccurate or outdated, incorrectly determined regarding impact, or incorrectly de-identified?'

label: DCH-22.2
content: 'Data Tags - Mechanisms exist to utilize data tags to automate tracking of sensitive/regulated data across the information lifecycle.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization utilize data tags to automate tracking of sensitive/regulated data across the information lifecycle?'

label: DCH-22.3
content: 'Primary Source Personal Data (PD) Collection - Mechanisms exist to collect Personal Data (PD) directly from the individual.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization collect Personal Data (PD) directly from the individual?'

label: DCH-23
content: 'De-Identification (Anonymization) - Mechanisms exist to anonymize data by removing Personal Data (PD) from datasets.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization anonymize data by removing Personal Data (PD) from datasets?'

label: DCH-23.1
content: 'De-Identify Dataset Upon Collection - Mechanisms exist to de-identify the dataset upon collection by not collecting Personal Data (PD).; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization de-identify the dataset upon collection by not collecting Personal Data (PD)?'

label: DCH-23.2
content: 'Archiving - Mechanisms exist to refrain from archiving Personal Data (PD) elements if those elements in a dataset will not be needed after the dataset is archived.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization refrain from archiving Personal Data (PD) elements if those elements in a dataset will not be needed after the dataset is archived?'

label: DCH-23.3
content: 'Release - Mechanisms exist to remove Personal Data (PD) elements from a dataset prior to its release if those elements in the dataset do not need to be part of the data release.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization remove Personal Data (PD) elements from a dataset prior to its release if those elements in the dataset do not need to be part of the data release?'

label: DCH-23.4
content: 'Removal, Masking, Encryption, Hashing or Replacement of Direct Identifiers - Mechanisms exist to remove, mask, encrypt, hash or replace direct identifiers in a dataset.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization remove, mask, encrypt, hash or replace direct identifiers in a dataset?'

label: DCH-23.5
content: 'Statistical Disclosure Control - Mechanisms exist to manipulate numerical data, contingency tables and statistical findings so that no person or organization is identifiable in the results of the analysis.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization manipulate numerical data, contingency tables and statistical findings so that no person or organization is identifiable in the results of the analysis?'

label: DCH-23.6
content: 'Differential Data Privacy - Mechanisms exist to prevent disclosure of Personal Data (PD) by adding non-deterministic noise to the results of mathematical operations before the results are reported.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization prevent disclosure of Personal Data (PD) by adding non-deterministic noise to the results of mathematical operations before the results are reported?'

label: DCH-23.7
content: 'Automated De-Identification of Sensitive Data - Mechanisms exist to perform de-identification of sensitive/regulated data, using validated algorithms and software to implement the algorithms.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization perform de-identification of sensitive/regulated data, using validated algorithms and software to implement the algorithms?'

label: DCH-23.8
content: 'Motivated Intruder - Mechanisms exist to perform a motivated intruder test on the de-identified dataset to determine if the identified data remains or if the de-identified data can be re-identified.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization perform a motivated intruder test on the de-identified dataset to determine if the identified data remains or if the de-identified data can be re-identified?'

label: DCH-23.9
content: 'Code Names - Mechanisms exist to use aliases to name assets, which are mission-critical and/or contain highly-sensitive/regulated data, are unique and not readily associated with a product, project or type of data.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization use aliases to name assets, which are mission-critical and/or contain highly-sensitive/regulated data, are unique and not readily associated with a product, project or type of data?'

label: DCH-24
content: 'Information Location - Mechanisms exist to identify and document the location of information and the specific system components on which the information resides.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization identify and document the location of information and the specific system components on which the information resides?'

label: DCH-24.1
content: 'Automated Tools to Support Information Location - Automated mechanisms exist to identify by data classification type to ensure adequate cybersecurity & data privacy controls are in place to protect organizational information and individual data privacy.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to identify by data classification type to ensure adequate cybersecurity & data privacy controls are in place to protect organizational information and individual data privacy?'

label: DCH-25
content: 'Transfer of Sensitive and/or Regulated Data - Mechanisms exist to restrict and govern the transfer of sensitive and/or regulated data to third-countries or international organizations.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization restrict and govern the transfer of sensitive and/or regulated data to third-countries or international organizations?'

label: DCH-25.1
content: 'Transfer Activity Limits - Mechanisms exist to establish organization-defined "normal business activities" to identify anomalous transaction activities that can reduce the opportunity for sending (outbound) and/or receiving (inbound) fraudulent actions.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization establish organization-defined "normal business activities" to identify anomalous transaction activities that can reduce the opportunity for sending (outbound) and/or receiving (inbound) fraudulent actions?'

label: DCH-26
content: 'Data Localization - Mechanisms exist to constrain the impact of "digital sovereignty laws," that require localized data within the host country, where data and processes may be subjected to arbitrary enforcement actions that potentially violate other applicable statutory, regulatory and/or contractual obligations.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization constrain the impact of "digital sovereignty laws," that require localized data within the host country, where data and processes may be subjected to arbitrary enforcement actions that potentially violate other applicable statutory, regulatory and/or contractual obligations?'

label: DCH-27
content: 'Data Rights Management (DRM) - Mechanisms exist to utilize Data Rights Management (DRM), or similar technologies, to protect Intellectual Property (IP) rights by preventing the unauthorized distribution and/or modification of sensitive IP.; Domain: Data Classification & Handling; Questions: Does the organization utilize Data Rights Management (DRM), or similar technologies, to protect Intellectual Property (IP) rights by preventing the unauthorized distribution and/or modification of sensitive IP?'

label: EMB-01
content: 'Embedded Technology Security Program - Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of embedded technology controls.; Domain: Embedded Technology; Questions: Does the organization facilitate the implementation of embedded technology controls?'

label: EMB-02
content: 'Internet of Things (IOT) - Mechanisms exist to proactively manage the cybersecurity & data privacy risks associated with Internet of Things (IoT).; Domain: Embedded Technology; Questions: Does the organization proactively manage the cybersecurity & data privacy risks associated with Internet of Things (IoT)?'

label: EMB-03
content: 'Operational Technology (OT) - Mechanisms exist to proactively manage the cybersecurity & data privacy risks associated with Operational Technology (OT).; Domain: Embedded Technology; Questions: Does the organization proactively manage the cybersecurity & data privacy risks associated with Operational Technology (OT)?'

label: EMB-04
content: 'Interface Security - Mechanisms exist to protect embedded devices against unauthorized use of the physical factory diagnostic and test interface(s).; Domain: Embedded Technology; Questions: Does the organization protect embedded devices against unauthorized use of the physical factory diagnostic and test interface(s)?'

label: EMB-05
content: 'Embedded Technology Configuration Monitoring - Mechanisms exist to generate log entries on embedded devices when configuration changes or attempts to access interfaces are detected.; Domain: Embedded Technology; Questions: Does the organization generate log entries on embedded devices when configuration changes or attempts to access interfaces are detected?'

label: EMB-06
content: 'Prevent Alterations - Mechanisms exist to protect embedded devices by preventing the unauthorized installation and execution of software.; Domain: Embedded Technology; Questions: Does the organization protect embedded devices by preventing the unauthorized installation and execution of software?'

label: EMB-07
content: 'Embedded Technology Maintenance - Mechanisms exist to securely update software and upgrade functionality on embedded devices.; Domain: Embedded Technology; Questions: Does the organization securely update software and upgrade functionality on embedded devices?'

label: EMB-08
content: 'Resilience To Outages - Mechanisms exist to configure embedded technology to be resilient to data network and power outages.; Domain: Embedded Technology; Questions: Does the organization configure embedded technology to be resilient to data network and power outages?'

label: EMB-09
content: 'Power Level Monitoring - Automated mechanisms exist to monitor the power levels of embedded technologies for decreased or excessive power usage, including battery drainage, to investigate for device tampering.; Domain: Embedded Technology; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to monitor the power levels of embedded technologies for decreased or excessive power usage, including battery drainage, to investigate for device tampering?'

label: EMB-10
content: 'Embedded Technology Reviews - Mechanisms exist to perform evaluations of deployed embedded technologies as needed, or at least on an annual basis, to ensure that necessary updates to mitigate the risks associated with legacy embedded technologies are identified and implemented.; Domain: Embedded Technology; Questions: Does the organization perform evaluations of deployed embedded technologies as needed, or at least on an annual basis, to ensure that necessary updates to mitigate the risks associated with legacy embedded technologies are identified and implemented?'

label: EMB-11
content: 'Message Queuing Telemetry Transport (MQTT) Security - Mechanisms exist to enforce the security of Message Queuing Telemetry Transport (MQTT) traffic.; Domain: Embedded Technology; Questions: Does the organization enforce the security of Message Queuing Telemetry Transport (MQTT) traffic?'

label: EMB-12
content: 'Restrict Communications - Mechanisms exist to require embedded technologies to initiate all communications and drop new, incoming communications.; Domain: Embedded Technology; Questions: Does the organization require embedded technologies to initiate all communications and drop new, incoming communications?'

label: EMB-13
content: 'Authorized Communications - Mechanisms exist to restrict embedded technologies to communicate only with authorized peers and service endpoints.; Domain: Embedded Technology; Questions: Does the organization restrict embedded technologies to communicate only with authorized peers and service endpoints?'

label: EMB-14
content: 'Operating Environment Certification - Mechanisms exist to determine if embedded technologies are certified for secure use in the proposed operating environment.; Domain: Embedded Technology; Questions: Does the organization determine if embedded technologies are certified for secure use in the proposed operating environment?'

label: EMB-15
content: 'Safety Assessment - Mechanisms exist to evaluate the safety aspects of embedded technologies via a fault tree analysis, or similar method, to determine possible consequences of misuse, misconfiguration and/or failure.; Domain: Embedded Technology; Questions: Does the organization evaluate the safety aspects of embedded technologies via a fault tree analysis, or similar method, to determine possible consequences of misuse, misconfiguration and/or failure?'

label: EMB-16
content: 'Certificate-Based Authentication - Mechanisms exist to enforce certificate-based authentication for embedded technologies (e.g., IoT, OT, etc.) and their supporting services.; Domain: Embedded Technology; Questions: Does the organization enforce certificate-based authentication for embedded technologies (e.g., IoT, OT, etc.) and their supporting services?'

label: EMB-17
content: 'Chip-To-Cloud Security - Mechanisms exist to implement embedded technologies that utilize pre-provisioned cloud trust anchors to support secure bootstrap and Zero Touch Provisioning (ZTP).; Domain: Embedded Technology; Questions: Does the organization implement embedded technologies that utilize pre-provisioned cloud trust anchors to support secure bootstrap and Zero Touch Provisioning (ZTP)?'

label: EMB-18
content: 'Real-Time Operating System (RTOS) Security - Mechanisms exist to ensure embedded technologies utilize a securely configured Real-Time Operating System (RTOS).; Domain: Embedded Technology; Questions: Does the organization ensure embedded technologies utilize a securely configured Real-Time Operating System (RTOS)?'

label: EMB-19
content: 'Safe Operations - Mechanisms exist to continuously validate autonomous systems that trigger an automatic state change when safe operation is no longer assured.; Domain: Embedded Technology; Questions: Does the organization continuously validate autonomous systems that trigger an automatic state change when safe operation is no longer assured?'

label: END-01
content: 'Endpoint Security - Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of endpoint security controls.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization facilitate the implementation of endpoint security controls?'

label: END-02
content: 'Endpoint Protection Measures - Mechanisms exist to protect the confidentiality, integrity, availability and safety of endpoint devices.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization protect the confidentiality, integrity, availability and safety of endpoint devices?'

label: END-03
content: 'Prohibit Installation Without Privileged Status - Automated mechanisms exist to prohibit software installations without explicitly assigned privileged status.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to prohibit software installations without explicitly assigned privileged status?'

label: END-03.1
content: 'Software Installation Alerts - Mechanisms exist to generate an alert when new software is detected.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization generate an alert when new software is detected?'

label: END-03.2
content: 'Governing Access Restriction for Change - Mechanisms exist to define, document, approve and enforce access restrictions associated with changes to systems.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization define, document, approve and enforce access restrictions associated with changes to systems?'

label: END-04
content: 'Malicious Code Protection (Anti-Malware) - Mechanisms exist to utilize antimalware technologies to detect and eradicate malicious code.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization utilize antimalware technologies to detect and eradicate malicious code?'

label: END-04.1
content: 'Automatic Antimalware Signature Updates - Mechanisms exist to automatically update antimalware technologies, including signature definitions.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization automatically update antimalware technologies, including signature definitions?'

label: END-04.2
content: 'Documented Protection Measures - Mechanisms exist to document antimalware technologies.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization document antimalware technologies?'

label: END-04.3
content: 'Centralized Management of Antimalware Technologies - Mechanisms exist to centrally-manage antimalware technologies.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization centrally-manage antimalware technologies?'

label: END-04.4
content: 'Heuristic / Nonsignature-Based Detection - Mechanisms exist to utilize heuristic / nonsignature-based antimalware detection capabilities.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization utilize heuristic / nonsignature-based antimalware detection capabilities?'

label: END-04.5
content: 'Malware Protection Mechanism Testing - Mechanisms exist to test antimalware technologies by introducing a known benign, non-spreading test case into the system and subsequently verifying that both detection of the test case and associated incident reporting occurs.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization test antimalware technologies by introducing a known benign, non-spreading test case into the system and subsequently verifying that both detection of the test case and associated incident reporting occurs?'

label: END-04.6
content: 'Evolving Malware Threats - Mechanisms exist to perform periodic evaluations evolving malware threats to assess systems that are generally not considered to be commonly affected by malicious software.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization perform periodic evaluations evolving malware threats to assess systems that are generally not considered to be commonly affected by malicious software?'

label: END-04.7
content: 'Always On Protection - Mechanisms exist to ensure that anti-malware technologies are continuously running in real-time and cannot be disabled or altered by non-privileged users, unless specifically authorized by management on a case-by-case basis for a limited time period.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization ensure that anti-malware technologies are continuously running in real-time and cannot be disabled or altered by non-privileged users, unless specifically authorized by management on a case-by-case basis for a limited time period?'

label: END-05
content: 'Software Firewall - Mechanisms exist to utilize host-based firewall software, or a similar technology, on all information systems, where technically feasible.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization utilize host-based firewall software, or a similar technology, on all information systems, where technically feasible?'

label: END-06
content: 'Endpoint File Integrity Monitoring (FIM) - Mechanisms exist to utilize File Integrity Monitor (FIM), or similar technologies, to detect and report on unauthorized changes to selected files and configuration settings.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization utilize File Integrity Monitor (FIM), or similar technologies, to detect and report on unauthorized changes to selected files and configuration settings?'

label: END-06.1
content: 'Integrity Checks - Mechanisms exist to validate configurations through integrity checking of software and firmware.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization validate configurations through integrity checking of software and firmware?'

label: END-06.2
content: 'Endpoint Detection & Response (EDR) - Mechanisms exist to detect and respond to unauthorized configuration changes as cybersecurity incidents.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization detect and respond to unauthorized configuration changes as cybersecurity incidents?'

label: END-06.3
content: 'Automated Notifications of Integrity Violations - Automated mechanisms exist to alert incident response personnel upon discovering discrepancies during integrity verification.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to alert incident response personnel upon discovering discrepancies during integrity verification?'

label: END-06.4
content: 'Automated Response to Integrity Violations - Automated mechanisms exist to implement remediation actions when integrity violations are discovered.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to implement remediation actions when integrity violations are discovered?'

label: END-06.5
content: 'Boot Process Integrity - Automated mechanisms exist to verify the integrity of the boot process of information systems.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to verify the integrity of the boot process of information systems?'

label: END-06.6
content: 'Protection of Boot Firmware - Automated mechanisms exist to protect the integrity of boot firmware in information systems.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to protect the integrity of boot firmware in information systems?'

label: END-06.7
content: 'Binary or Machine-Executable Code - Mechanisms exist to prohibit the use of binary or machine-executable code from sources with limited or no warranty and without access to source code.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization prohibit the use of binary or machine-executable code from sources with limited or no warranty and without access to source code?'

label: END-07
content: 'Host Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems (HIDS / HIPS) - Mechanisms exist to utilize Host-based Intrusion Detection / Prevention Systems (HIDS / HIPS), or similar technologies, to monitor for and protect against anomalous host activity, including lateral movement across the network.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization utilize Host-based Intrusion Detection / Prevention Systems (HIDS / HIPS), or similar technologies, to monitor for and protect against anomalous host activity, including lateral movement across the network?'

label: END-08
content: 'Phishing & Spam Protection - Mechanisms exist to utilize anti-phishing and spam protection technologies to detect and take action on unsolicited messages transported by electronic mail.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization utilize anti-phishing and spam protection technologies to detect and take action on unsolicited messages transported by electronic mail?'

label: END-08.1
content: 'Central Management - Mechanisms exist to centrally-manage anti-phishing and spam protection technologies.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization centrally-manage anti-phishing and spam protection technologies?'

label: END-08.2
content: 'Automatic Spam and Phishing Protection Updates - Mechanisms exist to automatically update anti-phishing and spam protection technologies when new releases are available in accordance with configuration and change management practices.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization automatically update anti-phishing and spam protection technologies when new releases are available in accordance with configuration and change management practices?'

label: END-09
content: 'Trusted Path - Mechanisms exist to establish a trusted communications path between the user and the security functions of the operating system.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization establish a trusted communications path between the user and the security functions of the operating system?'

label: END-10
content: 'Mobile Code - Mechanisms exist to address mobile code / operating system-independent applications.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization address mobile code / operating system-independent applications?'

label: END-11
