content: 'Thin Nodes - Mechanisms exist to configure thin nodes to have minimal functionality and information storage.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization configure thin nodes to have minimal functionality and information storage?'

label: END-12
content: 'Port & Input / Output (I/O) Device Access - Mechanisms exist to physically disable or remove unnecessary connection ports or input/output devices from sensitive systems.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization physically disable or remove unnecessary connection ports or input/output devices from sensitive systems?'

label: END-13
content:
'Sensor Capability - Mechanisms exist to configure embedded sensors on systems to: 
 (1) Prohibit the remote activation of sensing capabilities; and
 (2) Provide an explicit indication of sensor use to users.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization configure embedded sensors on systems to: 
 (1) Prohibit the remote activation of sensing capabilities; and
 (2) Provide an explicit indication of sensor use to users?'

label: END-13.1
content: 'Authorized Use - Mechanisms exist to utilize organization-defined measures so that data or information collected by sensors is only used for authorized purposes.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization utilize organization-defined measures so that data or information collected by sensors is only used for authorized purposes?'

label: END-13.2
content: 'Notice of Collection - Mechanisms exist to notify individuals that Personal Data (PD) is collected by sensors.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization notify individuals that Personal Data (PD) is collected by sensors?'

label: END-13.3
content: 'Collection Minimization - Mechanisms exist to utilize sensors that are configured to minimize the collection of information about individuals.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization utilize sensors that are configured to minimize the collection of information about individuals?'

label: END-13.4
content: 'Sensor Delivery Verification - Mechanisms exist to verify embedded technology sensors are configured so that data collected by the sensor(s) is only reported to authorized individuals or roles.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization verify embedded technology sensors are configured so that data collected by the sensor(s) is only reported to authorized individuals or roles?'

label: END-14
content:
'Collaborative Computing Devices - Mechanisms exist to unplug or prohibit the remote activation of collaborative computing devices with the following exceptions: 
 (1) Networked whiteboards; 
 (2) Video teleconference cameras; and 
 (3) Teleconference microphones.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization unplug or prohibit the remote activation of collaborative computing devices with the following exceptions: 
 (1) Networked whiteboards; 
 (2) Video teleconference cameras; and 
 (3) Teleconference microphones?'

label: END-14.1
content: 'Disabling / Removal In Secure Work Areas - Mechanisms exist to disable or remove collaborative computing devices from critical information systems and secure work areas.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization disable or remove collaborative computing devices from critical information systems and secure work areas?'

label: END-14.2
content: 'Explicitly Indicate Current Participants - Automated mechanisms exist to provide an explicit indication of current participants in online meetings and teleconferences.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to provide an explicit indication of current participants in online meetings and teleconferences?'

label: END-14.3
content: 'Participant Identity Verification - Mechanisms exist to verify individual identities to ensure that access to virtual meetings is limited to appropriate individuals.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization verify individual identities to ensure that access to virtual meetings is limited to appropriate individuals?'

label: END-14.4
content: 'Participant Connection Management - Mechanisms exist to ensure the meeting host can positively control an individual's participation in virtual meetings.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization ensure the meeting host can positively control an individual's participation in virtual meetings?'

label: END-14.5
content: 'Malicious Link & File Protections - Automated mechanisms exist to detect malicious links and/or files in communications and prevent users from accessing those malicious links and/or files.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to detect malicious links and/or files in communications and prevent users from accessing those malicious links and/or files?'

label: END-14.6
content: 'Explicit Indication Of Use - Mechanisms exist to configure collaborative computing devices to provide physically-present individuals with an explicit indication of use.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization configure collaborative computing devices to provide physically-present individuals with an explicit indication of use?'

label: END-15
content: 'Hypervisor Access - Mechanisms exist to restrict access to hypervisor management functions or administrative consoles for systems hosting virtualized systems.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization restrict access to hypervisor management functions or administrative consoles for systems hosting virtualized systems?'

label: END-16
content: 'Restrict Access To Security Functions - Mechanisms exist to ensure security functions are restricted to authorized individuals and enforce least privilege control requirements for necessary job functions.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization ensure security functions are restricted to authorized individuals and enforce least privilege control requirements for necessary job functions?'

label: END-16.1
content: 'Host-Based Security Function Isolation - Mechanisms exist to implement underlying software separation mechanisms to facilitate security function isolation.; Domain: Endpoint Security; Questions: Does the organization implement underlying software separation mechanisms to facilitate security function isolation?'

label: GOV-01
content: 'Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance Program - Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of cybersecurity & data protection governance controls.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization facilitate the implementation of cybersecurity & data protection governance controls?'

label: GOV-01.1
content: 'Steering Committee & Program Oversight - Mechanisms exist to coordinate cybersecurity, data protection and business alignment through a steering committee or advisory board, comprised of key cybersecurity, data privacy and business executives, which meets formally and on a regular basis.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization coordinate cybersecurity, data protection and business alignment through a steering committee or advisory board, comprised of key cybersecurity, data privacy and business executives, which meets formally and on a regular basis?'

label: GOV-01.2
content: 'Status Reporting To Governing Body - Mechanisms exist to provide governance oversight reporting and recommendations to those entrusted to make executive decisions about matters considered material to the organization's cybersecurity & data protection program.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization provide governance oversight reporting and recommendations to those entrusted to make executive decisions about matters considered material to its cybersecurity & data protection program?'

label: GOV-02
content: 'Publishing Cybersecurity & Data Protection Documentation - Mechanisms exist to establish, maintain and disseminate cybersecurity & data protection policies, standards and procedures.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization establish, maintain and disseminate cybersecurity & data protection policies, standards and procedures?'

label: GOV-02.1
content: 'Exception Management - Mechanisms exist to prohibit exceptions to standards, except when the exception has been formally assessed for risk impact, approved and recorded.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization prohibit exceptions to standards, except when the exception has been formally assessed for risk impact, approved and recorded?'

label: GOV-03
content: 'Periodic Review & Update of Cybersecurity & Data Protection Program - Mechanisms exist to review the cybersecurity & data privacy program, including policies, standards and procedures, at planned intervals or if significant changes occur to ensure their continuing suitability, adequacy and effectiveness.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization review the cybersecurity & data privacy program, including policies, standards and procedures, at planned intervals or if significant changes occur to ensure their continuing suitability, adequacy and effectiveness?'

label: GOV-04
content: 'Assigned Cybersecurity & Data Protection Responsibilities - Mechanisms exist to assign one or more qualified individuals with the mission and resources to centrally-manage, coordinate, develop, implement and maintain an enterprise-wide cybersecurity & data protection program.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization assign one or more qualified individuals with the mission and resources to centrally-manage, coordinate, develop, implement and maintain an enterprise-wide cybersecurity & data protection program?'

label: GOV-04.1
content: 'Stakeholder Accountability Structure - Mechanisms exist to enforce an accountability structure so that appropriate teams and individuals are empowered, responsible and trained for mapping, measuring and managing data and technology-related risks.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization enforce an accountability structure so that appropriate teams and individuals are empowered, responsible and trained for mapping, measuring and managing data and technology-related risks?'

label: GOV-04.2
content: 'Authoritative Chain of Command - Mechanisms exist to establish an authoritative chain of command with clear lines of communication to remove ambiguity from individuals and teams related to managing data and technology-related risks.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization establish an authoritative chain of command with clear lines of communication to remove ambiguity from individuals and teams related to managing data and technology-related risks?'

label: GOV-05
content: 'Measures of Performance - Mechanisms exist to develop, report and monitor cybersecurity & data privacy program measures of performance.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization develop, report and monitor cybersecurity & data privacy program measures of performance?'

label: GOV-05.1
content: 'Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) - Mechanisms exist to develop, report and monitor Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to assist organizational management in performance monitoring and trend analysis of the cybersecurity & data privacy program.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization develop, report and monitor Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to assist organizational management in performance monitoring and trend analysis of the cybersecurity & data privacy program?'

label: GOV-05.2
content: 'Key Risk Indicators (KRIs) - Mechanisms exist to develop, report and monitor Key Risk Indicators (KRIs) to assist senior management in performance monitoring and trend analysis of the cybersecurity & data privacy program.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization develop, report and monitor Key Risk Indicators (KRIs) to assist senior management in performance monitoring and trend analysis of the cybersecurity & data privacy program?'

label: GOV-06
content: 'Contacts With Authorities - Mechanisms exist to identify and document appropriate contacts with relevant law enforcement and regulatory bodies.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization identify and document appropriate contacts with relevant law enforcement and regulatory bodies?'

label: GOV-07
content:
'Contacts With Groups & Associations - Mechanisms exist to establish contact with selected groups and associations within the cybersecurity & data privacy communities to: 
 (1) Facilitate ongoing cybersecurity & data privacy education and training for organizational personnel;
 (2) Maintain currency with recommended cybersecurity & data privacy practices, techniques and technologies; and
 (3) Share current cybersecurity and/or data privacy-related information including threats, vulnerabilities and incidents.
; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization establish contact with selected groups and associations within the cybersecurity & data privacy communities to: 
 (1) Facilitate ongoing cybersecurity & data privacy education and training for organizational personnel;
 (2) Maintain currency with recommended cybersecurity & data privacy practices, techniques and technologies; and
 (3) Share current cybersecurity and/or data privacy-related information including threats, vulnerabilities and incidents?'

label: GOV-08
content: 'Defining Business Context & Mission - Mechanisms exist to define the context of its business model and document the organization's mission.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization define the context of its business model and document the mission of the organization?'

label: GOV-09
content: 'Define Control Objectives - Mechanisms exist to establish control objectives as the basis for the selection, implementation and management of the organization's internal control system.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization establish control objectives as the basis for the selection, implementation and management of its internal control system?'

label: GOV-10
content: 'Data Governance - Mechanisms exist to facilitate data governance to oversee the organization's policies, standards and procedures so that sensitive/regulated data is effectively managed and maintained in accordance with applicable statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization facilitate data governance to oversee its policies, standards and procedures so that sensitive/regulated data is effectively managed and maintained in accordance with applicable statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations?'

label: GOV-11
content: 'Purpose Validation - Mechanisms exist to monitor mission/business-critical services or functions to ensure those resources are being used consistent with their intended purpose.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization monitor mission/business-critical services or functions to ensure those resources are being used consistent with their intended purpose?'

label: GOV-12
content: 'Forced Technology Transfer (FTT) - Mechanisms exist to avoid and/or constrain the forced exfiltration of sensitive / regulated information (e.g., Intellectual Property (IP)) to the host government for purposes of market access or market management practices.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization avoid and/or constrain the forced exfiltration of sensitive / regulated information (e.g., Intellectual Property (IP)) to the host government for purposes of market access or market management practices?'

label: GOV-13
content: 'State-Sponsored Espionage - Mechanisms exist to constrain the host government's ability to leverage the organization's technology assets for economic or political espionage and/or cyberwarfare activities.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization constrain the host government's ability to leverage its technology assets for economic or political espionage and/or cyberwarfare activities?'

label: GOV-14
content: 'Business As Usual (BAU) Secure Practices - Mechanisms exist to incorporate cybersecurity & data privacy principles into Business As Usual (BAU) practices through executive leadership involvement.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization incorporate cybersecurity & data privacy principles into Business As Usual (BAU) practices through executive leadership involvement?'

label: GOV-15
content: 'Operationalizing Cybersecurity & Data Protection Practices - Mechanisms exist to compel data and/or process owners to operationalize cybersecurity & data privacy practices for each system, application and/or service under their control.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization compel data and/or process owners to operationalize cybersecurity & data privacy practices for each system, application and/or service under their control?'

label: GOV-15.1
content: 'Select Controls - Mechanisms exist to compel data and/or process owners to select required cybersecurity & data privacy controls for each system, application and/or service under their control.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization compel data and/or process owners to select required cybersecurity & data privacy controls for each system, application and/or service under their control?'

label: GOV-15.2
content: 'Implement Controls - Mechanisms exist to compel data and/or process owners to implement required cybersecurity & data privacy controls for each system, application and/or service under their control.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization compel data and/or process owners to implement required cybersecurity & data privacy controls for each system, application and/or service under their control?'

label: GOV-15.3
content: 'Assess Controls - Mechanisms exist to compel data and/or process owners to assess if required cybersecurity & data privacy controls for each system, application and/or service under their control are implemented correctly and are operating as intended.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization compel data and/or process owners to assess if required cybersecurity & data privacy controls for each system, application and/or service under their control are implemented correctly and are operating as intended?'

label: GOV-15.4
content: 'Authorize Systems, Applications & Services - Mechanisms exist to compel data and/or process owners to obtain authorization for the production use of each system, application and/or service under their control.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization compel data and/or process owners to obtain authorization for the production use of each system, application and/or service under their control?'

label: GOV-15.5
content: 'Monitor Controls - Mechanisms exist to compel data and/or process owners to monitor systems, applications and/or services under their control on an ongoing basis for applicable threats and risks, as well as to ensure cybersecurity & data privacy controls are operating as intended.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization compel data and/or process owners to monitor systems, applications and/or services under their control on an ongoing basis for applicable threats and risks, as well as to ensure cybersecurity & data privacy controls are operating as intended?'

label: GOV-16
content: 'Materiality Determination - Mechanisms exist to define materiality threshold criteria capable of designating an incident as material.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization define materiality threshold criteria capable of designating an incident as material?'

label: GOV-16.1
content: 'Material Risks - Mechanisms exist to define criteria necessary to designate a risk as a material risk.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization define criteria necessary to designate a risk as a material risk?'

label: GOV-16.2
content: 'Material Threats - Mechanisms exist to define criteria necessary to designate a threat as a material threat.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization define criteria necessary to designate a threat as a material threat?'

label: GOV-17
content: 'Cybersecurity & Data Privacy Status Reporting - Mechanisms exist to submit status reporting of the organization's cybersecurity and/or data privacy program to applicable statutory and/or regulatory authorities, as required.; Domain: Cybersecurity & Data Protection Governance; Questions: Does the organization submit status reporting of its cybersecurity and/or data privacy program to applicable statutory and/or regulatory authorities, as required?'

label: HRS-01
content: 'Human Resources Security Management - Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of personnel security controls.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization facilitate the implementation of personnel security controls?'

label: HRS-01.1
content:
'Onboarding, Transferring & Offboarding Personnel - Mechanisms exist to proactively govern the following personnel management actions:
(1) Onboarding new personnel (e.g., new hires);
(2) Transferring personnel into new roles within the organization; and 
(3) Offboarding personnel (e.g., termination of employment).; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization proactively govern the following personnel management actions:
(1) Onboarding new personnel (e.g., new hires);
(2) Transferring personnel into new roles within the organization; and 
(3) Offboarding personnel (e.g., termination of employment)?'

label: HRS-02
content: 'Position Categorization - Mechanisms exist to manage personnel security risk by assigning a risk designation to all positions and establishing screening criteria for individuals filling those positions.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization manage personnel security risk by assigning a risk designation to all positions and establishing screening criteria for individuals filling those positions?'

label: HRS-02.1
content: 'Users With Elevated Privileges - Mechanisms exist to ensure that every user accessing a system that processes, stores, or transmits sensitive information is cleared and regularly trained to handle the information in question.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization ensure that every user accessing a system that processes, stores, or transmits sensitive information is cleared and regularly trained to handle the information in question?'

label: HRS-02.2
content: 'Probationary Periods - Mechanisms exist to identify newly onboarded personnel for enhanced monitoring during their probationary period.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization identify newly onboarded personnel for enhanced monitoring during their probationary period?'

label: HRS-03
content: 'Defined Roles & Responsibilities - Mechanisms exist to define cybersecurity roles & responsibilities for all personnel.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization define cybersecurity roles & responsibilities for all personnel?'

label: HRS-03.1
content: 'User Awareness - Mechanisms exist to communicate with users about their roles and responsibilities to maintain a safe and secure working environment.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization communicate with users about their roles and responsibilities to maintain a safe and secure working environment?'

label: HRS-03.2
content: 'Competency Requirements for Security-Related Positions - Mechanisms exist to ensure that all security-related positions are staffed by qualified individuals who have the necessary skill set.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization ensure that all security-related positions are staffed by qualified individuals who have the necessary skill set?'

label: HRS-04
content: 'Personnel Screening - Mechanisms exist to manage personnel security risk by screening individuals prior to authorizing access.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization manage personnel security risk by screening individuals prior to authorizing access?'

label: HRS-04.1
content: 'Roles With Special Protection Measures - Mechanisms exist to ensure that individuals accessing a system that stores, transmits or processes information requiring special protection satisfy organization-defined personnel screening criteria.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization ensure that individuals accessing a system that stores, transmits or processes information requiring special protection satisfy organization-defined personnel screening criteria?'

label: HRS-04.2
content: 'Formal Indoctrination - Mechanisms exist to verify that individuals accessing a system processing, storing, or transmitting sensitive information are formally indoctrinated for all the relevant types of information to which they have access on the system.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization verify that individuals accessing a system processing, storing, or transmitting sensitive information are formally indoctrinated for all the relevant types of information to which they have access on the system?'

label: HRS-04.3
content: 'Citizenship Requirements - Mechanisms exist to verify that individuals accessing a system processing, storing, or transmitting sensitive information meet applicable statutory, regulatory and/or contractual requirements for citizenship.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization verify that individuals accessing a system processing, storing, or transmitting sensitive information meet applicable statutory, regulatory and/or contractual requirements for citizenship?'

label: HRS-04.4
content: 'Citizenship Identification - Mechanisms exist to identify foreign nationals, including by their specific citizenship.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization identify foreign nationals, including by their specific citizenship?'

label: HRS-05
content: 'Terms of Employment - Mechanisms exist to require all employees and contractors to apply cybersecurity & data privacy principles in their daily work.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization require all employees and contractors to apply cybersecurity & data privacy principles in their daily work?'

label: HRS-05.1
content: 'Rules of Behavior - Mechanisms exist to define acceptable and unacceptable rules of behavior for the use of technologies, including consequences for unacceptable behavior.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization define acceptable and unacceptable rules of behavior for the use of technologies, including consequences for unacceptable behavior?'

label: HRS-05.2
content: 'Social Media & Social Networking Restrictions - Mechanisms exist to define rules of behavior that contain explicit restrictions on the use of social media and networking sites, posting information on commercial websites and sharing account information.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization define rules of behavior that contain explicit restrictions on the use of social media and networking sites, posting information on commercial websites and sharing account information?'

label: HRS-05.3
content: 'Use of Communications Technology - Mechanisms exist to establish usage restrictions and implementation guidance for communications technologies based on the potential to cause damage to systems, if used maliciously.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization establish usage restrictions and implementation guidance for communications technologies based on the potential to cause damage to systems, if used maliciously?'

label: HRS-05.4
content: 'Use of Critical Technologies - Mechanisms exist to govern usage policies for critical technologies.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization govern usage policies for critical technologies?'

label: HRS-05.5
content: 'Use of Mobile Devices - Mechanisms exist to manage business risks associated with permitting mobile device access to organizational resources.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization manage business risks associated with permitting mobile device access to organizational resources?'

label: HRS-05.6
content: 'Security-Minded Dress Code - Mechanisms exist to prohibit the use of oversized clothing (e.g., baggy pants, oversized hooded sweatshirts, etc.) to prevent the unauthorized exfiltration of data and technology assets.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization prohibit the use of oversized clothing (e.g., baggy pants, oversized hooded sweatshirts, etc.) to prevent the unauthorized exfiltration of data and technology assets?'

label: HRS-05.7
content: 'Policy Familiarization & Acknowledgement - Mechanisms exist to ensure personnel receive recurring familiarization with the organization's cybersecurity & data privacy policies and provide acknowledgement.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization ensure personnel receive recurring familiarization with its cybersecurity & data privacy policies and provide acknowledgement?'

label: HRS-06
content: 'Access Agreements - Mechanisms exist to require internal and third-party users to sign appropriate access agreements prior to being granted access.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization require internal and third-party users to sign appropriate access agreements prior to being granted access?'

label: HRS-06.1
content: 'Confidentiality Agreements - Mechanisms exist to require Non-Disclosure Agreements (NDAs) or similar confidentiality agreements that reflect the needs to protect data and operational details, or both employees and third-parties.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization require Non-Disclosure Agreements (NDAs) or similar confidentiality agreements that reflect the needs to protect data and operational details, or both employees and third-parties?'

label: HRS-06.2
content: 'Post-Employment Obligations - Mechanisms exist to notify terminated individuals of applicable, legally-binding post-employment requirements for the protection of sensitive organizational information.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization notify terminated individuals of applicable, legally-binding post-employment requirements for the protection of sensitive organizational information?'

label: HRS-07
content: 'Personnel Sanctions - Mechanisms exist to sanction personnel failing to comply with established security policies, standards and procedures.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization sanction personnel failing to comply with established security policies, standards and procedures?'

label: HRS-07.1
content: 'Workplace Investigations - Mechanisms exist to conduct employee misconduct investigations when there is reasonable assurance that a policy has been violated.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization conduct employee misconduct investigations when there is reasonable assurance that a policy has been violated?'

label: HRS-08
content: 'Personnel Transfer - Mechanisms exist to adjust logical and physical access authorizations to systems and facilities upon personnel reassignment or transfer, in a timely manner.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization adjust logical and physical access authorizations to systems and facilities upon personnel reassignment or transfer, in a timely manner?'

label: HRS-09
content: 'Personnel Termination - Mechanisms exist to govern the termination of individual employment.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization govern the termination of individual employment?'

label: HRS-09.1
content: 'Asset Collection - Mechanisms exist to retrieve organization-owned assets upon termination of an individual's employment.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization retrieve organization-owned assets upon termination of an individual's employment?'

label: HRS-09.2
content: 'High-Risk Terminations - Mechanisms exist to expedite the process of removing "high risk" individual’s access to systems and applications upon termination, as determined by management.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization expedite the process of removing "high risk" individual’s access to systems and applications upon termination, as determined by management?'

label: HRS-09.3
content: 'Post-Employment Requirements - Mechanisms exist to govern former employee behavior by notifying terminated individuals of applicable, legally binding post-employment requirements for the protection of organizational information.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization govern former employee behavior by notifying terminated individuals of applicable, legally binding post-employment requirements for the protection of organizational information?'

label: HRS-09.4
content: 'Automated Employment Status Notifications - Automated mechanisms exist to notify Identity and Access Management (IAM) personnel or roles upon termination of an individual employment or contract.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to notify Identity and Access Management (IAM) personnel or roles upon termination of an individual employment or contract?'

label: HRS-10
content: 'Third-Party Personnel Security - Mechanisms exist to govern third-party personnel by reviewing and monitoring third-party cybersecurity & data privacy roles and responsibilities.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization govern third-party personnel by reviewing and monitoring third-party cybersecurity & data privacy roles and responsibilities?'

label: HRS-11
content: 'Separation of Duties (SoD) - Mechanisms exist to implement and maintain Separation of Duties (SoD) to prevent potential inappropriate activity without collusion.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization implement and maintain Separation of Duties (SoD) to prevent potential inappropriate activity without collusion?'

label: HRS-12
content: 'Incompatible Roles - Mechanisms exist to avoid incompatible development-specific roles through limiting and reviewing developer privileges to change hardware, software and firmware components within a production/operational environment.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization avoid incompatible development-specific roles through limiting and reviewing developer privileges to change hardware, software and firmware components within a production/operational environment?'

label: HRS-12.1
content: 'Two-Person Rule - Mechanisms exist to enforce a two-person rule for implementing changes to sensitive systems.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization enforce a two-person rule for implementing changes to sensitive systems?'

label: HRS-13
content: 'Identify Critical Skills & Gaps - Mechanisms exist to evaluate the critical cybersecurity & data privacy skills needed to support the organization's mission and identify gaps that exist.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization evaluate the critical cybersecurity & data privacy skills needed to support its mission and identify gaps that exist?'

label: HRS-13.1
content: 'Remediate Identified Skills Deficiencies - Mechanisms exist to remediate critical skills deficiencies necessary to support the organization's mission and business functions.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization remediate critical skills deficiencies necessary to support its mission and business functions?'

label: HRS-13.2
content: 'Identify Vital Cybersecurity & Data Privacy Staff - Mechanisms exist to identify vital cybersecurity & data privacy staff.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization identify vital cybersecurity & data privacy staff?'

label: HRS-13.3
content: 'Establish Redundancy for Vital Cybersecurity & Data Privacy Staff - Mechanisms exist to establish redundancy for vital cybersecurity & data privacy staff.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization establish redundancy for vital cybersecurity & data privacy staff?'

label: HRS-13.4
content: 'Perform Succession Planning - Mechanisms exist to perform succession planning for vital cybersecurity & data privacy roles.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization perform succession planning for vital cybersecurity & data privacy roles?'

label: HRS-14
content:
'Identifying Authorized Work Locations - Mechanisms exist to identify and document authorized working locations, including:
(1) Designated on-premises, organization-controlled work locations; and
(2) Other off-premises locations not under organization-control (e.g., work from home).; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization identity and document authorized working locations, including:
(1) Designated on-premises, organization-controlled work locations; and
(2) Other off-premises locations not under organization-control (e.g., work from home)?'

label: HRS-14.1
content: 'Communicating Authorized Work Locations - Mechanisms exist to communicate authorized work locations to organizational personnel.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization communicate authorized work locations to organizational personnel?'

label: HRS-15
content: 'Reporting Suspicious Activities - Mechanisms exist to empower personnel to efficiently report suspicious activities and/or behavior without fear of reprisal or other negative consequences.; Domain: Human Resources Security; Questions: Does the organization empower personnel to efficiently report suspicious activities and/or behavior without fear of reprisal or other negative consequences?'

label: IAC-01
content: 'Identity & Access Management (IAM) - Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of identification and access management controls.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization facilitate the implementation of identification and access management controls?'

label: IAC-01.1
content: 'Retain Access Records - Mechanisms exist to retain a record of personnel accountability to ensure there is a record of all access granted to an individual (system and application-wise), who provided the authorization, when the authorization was granted and when the access was last reviewed.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization retain a record of personnel accountability to ensure there is a record of all access granted to an individual (system and application-wise), who provided the authorization, when the authorization was granted and when the access was last reviewed?'

label: IAC-01.2
content: 'Authenticate, Authorize and Audit (AAA) - Mechanisms exist to strictly govern the use of Authenticate, Authorize and Audit (AAA) solutions, both on-premises and those hosted by an External Service Provider (ESP).; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization strictly govern the use of Authenticate, Authorize and Audit (AAA) solutions, both on-premises and those hosted by an External Service Provider (ESP)?'

label: IAC-01.3
content: 'User & Service Account Inventories - Automated mechanisms exist to maintain a current list of authorized users and service accounts.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization maintain a current list of authorized users and services?'

label: IAC-02
content: 'Identification & Authentication for Organizational Users - Mechanisms exist to uniquely identify and centrally Authenticate, Authorize and Audit (AAA) organizational users and processes acting on behalf of organizational users.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization uniquely identify and centrally Authenticate, Authorize and Audit (AAA) organizational users and processes acting on behalf of organizational users?'

label: IAC-02.1
content: 'Group Authentication - Mechanisms exist to require individuals to be authenticated with an individual authenticator when a group authenticator is utilized.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization require individuals to be authenticated with an individual authenticator when a group authenticator is utilized?'

label: IAC-02.2
content: 'Replay-Resistant Authentication - Automated mechanisms exist to employ replay-resistant authentication.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to employ replay-resistant authentication?'

label: IAC-02.3
content: 'Acceptance of PIV Credentials - Mechanisms exist to accept and electronically verify organizational Personal Identity Verification (PIV) credentials.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization accept and electronically verify organizational Personal Identity Verification (PIV) credentials?'

label: IAC-02.4
content: 'Out-of-Band Authentication (OOBA) - Mechanisms exist to implement Out-of-Band Authentication (OOBA) under specific conditions.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization implement Out-of-Band Authentication (OOBA) under specific conditions?'

label: IAC-03
content: 'Identification & Authentication for Non-Organizational Users - Mechanisms exist to uniquely identify and centrally Authenticate, Authorize and Audit (AAA) third-party users and processes that provide services to the organization.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization uniquely identify and centrally Authenticate, Authorize and Audit (AAA) third-party users and processes that provide services to the organization?'

label: IAC-03.1
content: 'Acceptance of PIV Credentials from Other Organizations - Mechanisms exist to accept and electronically verify Personal Identity Verification (PIV) credentials from third-parties.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization accept and electronically verify Personal Identity Verification (PIV) credentials from third-parties?'

label: IAC-03.2
content: 'Acceptance of Third-Party Credentials - Automated mechanisms exist to accept Federal Identity, Credential and Access Management (FICAM)-approved third-party credentials.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to accept Federal Identity, Credential and Access Management (FICAM)-approved third-party credentials?'

label: IAC-03.3
content: 'Use of FICAM-Issued Profiles - Mechanisms exist to conform systems to Federal Identity, Credential and Access Management (FICAM)-issued profiles.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization conform systems to Federal Identity, Credential and Access Management (FICAM)-issued profiles?'

label: IAC-03.4
content: 'Disassociability - Mechanisms exist to disassociate user attributes or credential assertion relationships among individuals, credential service providers and relying parties.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization disassociate user attributes or credential assertion relationships among individuals, credential service providers and relying parties?'

label: IAC-03.5
content: 'Acceptance of External Authenticators - Mechanisms exist to restrict the use of external authenticators to those that are National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)-compliant and maintain a list of accepted external authenticators.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization restrict the use of external authenticators to those that are National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)-compliant and maintain a list of accepted external authenticators?'

label: IAC-04
content: 'Identification & Authentication for Devices - Mechanisms exist to uniquely identify and centrally Authenticate, Authorize and Audit (AAA) devices before establishing a connection using bidirectional authentication that is cryptographically- based and replay resistant.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization uniquely identify and centrally Authenticate, Authorize and Audit (AAA) devices before establishing a connection using bidirectional authentication that is cryptographically- based and replay resistant?'

label: IAC-04.1
content: 'Device Attestation - Mechanisms exist to ensure device identification and authentication is accurate by centrally-managing the joining of systems to the domain as part of the initial asset configuration management process.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization ensure device identification and authentication is accurate by centrally-managing the joining of systems to the domain as part of the initial asset configuration management process?'

label: IAC-04.2
content: 'Device Authorization Enforcement - Mechanisms exist to enforce cryptographic communications keys to prevent one key from being used to access multiple devices.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization enforce cryptographic communications keys to prevent one key from being used to access multiple devices?'

label: IAC-05
content: 'Identification & Authentication for Third Party Systems & Services - Mechanisms exist to identify and authenticate third-party systems and services.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization identify and authenticate third-party systems and services?'

label: IAC-05.1
content: 'Sharing Identification & Authentication Information - Mechanisms exist to ensure external service providers provide current and accurate information for any third-party user with access to the organization's data or assets.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization ensure external service providers provide current and accurate information for any third-party user with access to its data or assets?'

label: IAC-05.2
content: 'Privileged Access by Non-Organizational Users - Mechanisms exist to prohibit privileged access by non-organizational users.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization prohibit privileged access by non-organizational users?'

label: IAC-06
content:
'Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) - Automated mechanisms exist to enforce Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for:
 (1) Remote network access; 
 (2) Third-party systems, applications and/or services; and/ or
 (3) Non-console access to critical systems or systems that store, transmit and/or process sensitive/regulated data.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to enforce Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for:
 (1) Remote network access; 
 (2) Third-party systems, applications and/or services; and/ or
 (3) Non-console access to critical systems or systems that store, transmit and/or process sensitive/regulated data?'

label: IAC-06.1
content: 'Network Access to Privileged Accounts - Mechanisms exist to utilize Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) to authenticate network access for privileged accounts.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization utilize Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) to authenticate network access for privileged accounts?'

label: IAC-06.2
content: 'Network Access to Non-Privileged Accounts - Mechanisms exist to utilize Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) to authenticate network access for non-privileged accounts.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization utilize Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) to authenticate network access for non-privileged accounts?'

label: IAC-06.3
content: 'Local Access to Privileged Accounts - Mechanisms exist to utilize Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) to authenticate local access for privileged accounts.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization utilize Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) to authenticate local access for privileged accounts?'

label: IAC-06.4
content: 'Out-of-Band Multi-Factor Authentication - Mechanisms exist to implement Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for access to privileged and non-privileged accounts such that one of the factors is independently provided by a device separate from the system being accessed.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization implements Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for access to privileged and non-privileged accounts such that one of the factors is securely provided by a device separate from the system gaining access?'

label: IAC-07
content: 'User Provisioning & De-Provisioning - Mechanisms exist to utilize a formal user registration and de-registration process that governs the assignment of access rights.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization utilize a formal user registration and de-registration process that governs the assignment of access rights?'

label: IAC-07.1
content: 'Change of Roles & Duties - Mechanisms exist to revoke user access rights following changes in personnel roles and duties, if no longer necessary or permitted.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization revoke user access rights following changes in personnel roles and duties, if no longer necessary or permitted?'

label: IAC-07.2
content: 'Termination of Employment - Mechanisms exist to revoke user access rights in a timely manner, upon termination of employment or contract.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization revoke user access rights in a timely manner, upon termination of employment or contract?'

label: IAC-08
content: 'Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) - Mechanisms exist to enforce a Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) policy over users and resources that applies need-to-know and fine-grained access control for sensitive/regulated data access.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization enforce a Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) policy over users and resources that applies need-to-know and fine-grained access control for sensitive/regulated data access?'

label: IAC-09
content: 'Identifier Management (User Names) - Mechanisms exist to govern naming standards for usernames and systems.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization govern naming standards for usernames and systems?'

label: IAC-09.1
content: 'User Identity (ID) Management - Mechanisms exist to ensure proper user identification management for non-consumer users and administrators.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization ensure proper user identification management for non-consumer users and administrators?'

label: IAC-09.2
content: 'Identity User Status - Mechanisms exist to identify contractors and other third-party users through unique username characteristics.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization identify contractors and other third-party users through unique username characteristics?'

label: IAC-09.3
content: 'Dynamic Management - Mechanisms exist to dynamically manage usernames and system identifiers.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization dynamically manage usernames and system identifiers?'

label: IAC-09.4
content: 'Cross-Organization Management - Mechanisms exist to coordinate username identifiers with external organizations for cross-organization management of identifiers.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization coordinate username identifiers with external organizations for cross-organization management of identifiers?'

label: IAC-09.5
content: 'Privileged Account Identifiers - Mechanisms exist to uniquely manage privileged accounts to identify the account as a privileged user or service.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization uniquely manage privileged accounts to identify the account as a privileged user or service?'

label: IAC-09.6
content: 'Pairwise Pseudonymous Identifiers (PPID) - Mechanisms exist to generate pairwise pseudonymous identifiers with no identifying information about a data subject to discourage activity tracking and profiling of the data subject.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization generate pairwise pseudonymous identifiers with no identifying information about a data subject to discourage activity tracking and profiling of the data subject?'

label: IAC-10
content: 'Authenticator Management - Mechanisms exist to securely manage authenticators for users and devices.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization securely manage authenticators for users and devices?'

label: IAC-10.1
content: 'Password-Based Authentication - Mechanisms exist to enforce complexity, length and lifespan considerations to ensure strong criteria for password-based authentication.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization enforce complexity, length and lifespan considerations to ensure strong criteria for password-based authentication?'

label: IAC-10.10
content: 'Expiration of Cached Authenticators - Automated mechanisms exist to prohibit the use of cached authenticators after organization-defined time period.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to prohibit the use of cached authenticators after organization-defined time period?'

label: IAC-10.11
content: 'Password Managers - Mechanisms exist to protect and store passwords via a password manager tool.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization protect and store passwords via a password manager tool?'

label: IAC-10.12
content: 'Biometric Authentication - Mechanisms exist to ensure biometric-based authentication satisfies organization-defined biometric quality requirements for false positives and false negatives.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization ensure biometric-based authentication satisfies organization-defined biometric quality requirements for false positives and false negatives?'

label: IAC-10.2
content: 'PKI-Based Authentication - Automated mechanisms exist to validate certificates by constructing and verifying a certification path to an accepted trust anchor including checking certificate status information for PKI-based authentication.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to validate certificates by constructing and verifying a certification path to an accepted trust anchor including checking certificate status information for PKI-based authentication?'

label: IAC-10.3
content: 'In-Person or Trusted Third-Party Registration - Mechanisms exist to conduct in-person or trusted third-party identify verification before user accounts for third-parties are created.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization conduct in-person or trusted third-party identify verification before user accounts for third-parties are created?'

label: IAC-10.4
content: 'Automated Support For Password Strength - Automated mechanisms exist to determine if password authenticators are sufficiently strong enough to satisfy organization-defined password length and complexity requirements.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to determine if password authenticators are sufficiently strong enough to satisfy organization-defined password length and complexity requirements?'

label: IAC-10.5
content: 'Protection of Authenticators - Mechanisms exist to protect authenticators commensurate with the sensitivity of the information to which use of the authenticator permits access.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization protect authenticators commensurate with the sensitivity of the information to which use of the authenticator permits access?'

label: IAC-10.6
content: 'No Embedded Unencrypted Static Authenticators - Mechanisms exist to ensure that unencrypted, static authenticators are not embedded in applications, scripts or stored on function keys.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization ensure that unencrypted, static authenticators are not embedded in applications, scripts or stored on function keys?'

label: IAC-10.7
content: 'Hardware Token-Based Authentication - Automated mechanisms exist to ensure organization-defined token quality requirements are satisfied for hardware token-based authentication.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to ensure organization-defined token quality requirements are satisfied for hardware token-based authentication?'

label: IAC-10.8
content: 'Default Authenticators - Mechanisms exist to ensure default authenticators are changed as part of account creation or system installation.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization ensure default authenticators are changed as part of account creation or system installation?'

label: IAC-10.9
content: 'Multiple Information System Accounts - Mechanisms exist to implement security safeguards to manage the risk of compromise due to individuals having accounts on multiple information systems.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization implement security safeguards to manage the risk of compromise due to individuals having accounts on multiple information systems?'

label: IAC-11
content: 'Authenticator Feedback - Mechanisms exist to obscure the feedback of authentication information during the authentication process to protect the information from possible exploitation/use by unauthorized individuals.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization obscure the feedback of authentication information during the authentication process to protect the information from possible exploitation/use by unauthorized individuals?'

label: IAC-12
content: 'Cryptographic Module Authentication - Mechanisms exist to ensure cryptographic modules adhere to applicable statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements for security strength.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization ensure cryptographic modules adhere to applicable statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements for security strength?'

label: IAC-12.1
content: 'Hardware Security Modules (HSM) - Automated mechanisms exist to utilize Hardware Security Modules (HSM) to protect authenticators on which the component relies.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to utilize Hardware Security Modules (HSM) to protect authenticators on which the component relies?'

label: IAC-13
content: 'Adaptive Identification & Authentication - Mechanisms exist to allow individuals to utilize alternative methods of authentication under specific circumstances or situations.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization allow individuals to utilize alternative methods of authentication under specific circumstances or situations?'

label: IAC-13.1
content: 'Single Sign-On (SSO) Transparent Authentication - Mechanisms exist to provide a transparent authentication (e.g., Single Sign-On (SSO)) capability to the organization's systems and services.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization provide a Single Sign-On (SSO) capability to its systems and services?'

label: IAC-13.2
content: 'Federated Credential Management - Mechanisms exist to federate credentials to allow cross-organization authentication of individuals and devices.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization federate credentials to allow cross-organization authentication of individuals and devices?'

label: IAC-13.3
content: 'Continuous Authentication - Automated mechanisms exist to enable continuous re-authentication through the lifecycle of entity interactions.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to enable continuous re-authentication through the lifecycle of entity interactions?'

label: IAC-14
content: 'Re-Authentication - Mechanisms exist to force users and devices to re-authenticate according to organization-defined circumstances that necessitate re-authentication.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization force users and devices to re-authenticate according to organization-defined circumstances that necessitate re-authentication?'

label: IAC-15
content: 'Account Management - Mechanisms exist to proactively govern account management of individual, group, system, service, application, guest and temporary accounts.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization proactively govern account management of individual, group, system, service, application, guest and temporary accounts?'

label: IAC-15.1
content: 'Automated System Account Management (Directory Services) - Automated mechanisms exist to support the management of system accounts (e.g., directory services).; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to support the management of system accounts?'

label: IAC-15.2
content: 'Removal of Temporary / Emergency Accounts - Automated mechanisms exist to disable or remove temporary and emergency accounts after an organization-defined time period for each type of account.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to disable or remove temporary and emergency accounts after an organization-defined time period for each type of account?'

label: IAC-15.3
content: 'Disable Inactive Accounts - Automated mechanisms exist to disable inactive accounts after an organization-defined time period.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to disable inactive accounts after an organization-defined time period?'

label: IAC-15.4
content: 'Automated Audit Actions - Automated mechanisms exist to audit account creation, modification, enabling, disabling and removal actions and notify organization-defined personnel or roles.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to audit account creation, modification, enabling, disabling and removal actions and notify organization-defined personnel or roles?'

label: IAC-15.5
content: 'Restrictions on Shared Groups / Accounts - Mechanisms exist to authorize the use of shared/group accounts only under certain organization-defined conditions.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization authorize the use of shared/group accounts only under certain organization-defined conditions?'

label: IAC-15.6
content: 'Account Disabling for High Risk Individuals - Mechanisms exist to disable accounts immediately upon notification for users posing a significant risk to the organization.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization disable accounts immediately upon notification for users posing a significant risk to the organization?'

label: IAC-15.7
content: 'System Account Reviews - Mechanisms exist to review all system accounts and disable any account that cannot be associated with a business process and owner.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization review all system accounts and disables any account that cannot be associated with a business process and owner?'

label: IAC-15.8
content: 'Usage Conditions - Automated mechanisms exist to enforce usage conditions for users and/or roles.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to enforce usage conditions for users and/or roles?'

label: IAC-15.9
content: 'Emergency Accounts - Mechanisms exist to establish and control "emergency access only" accounts.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization establish and control "emergency access only" accounts?'

label: IAC-16
content: 'Privileged Account Management (PAM) - Mechanisms exist to restrict and control privileged access rights for users and services.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization restrict and control privileged access rights for users and services?'

label: IAC-16.1
content: 'Privileged Account Inventories - Mechanisms exist to inventory all privileged accounts and validate that each person with elevated privileges is authorized by the appropriate level of organizational management.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization inventory all privileged accounts and validate that each person with elevated privileges is authorized by the appropriate level of organizational management?'

label: IAC-16.2
content: 'Privileged Account Separation - Mechanisms exist to separate privileged accounts between infrastructure environments to reduce the risk of a compromise in one infrastructure environment from laterally affecting other infrastructure environments.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization separate privileged accounts between infrastructure environments to reduce the risk of a compromise in one infrastructure environment from laterally affecting other infrastructure environments?'

label: IAC-17
content: 'Periodic Review of Account Privileges - Mechanisms exist to periodically-review the privileges assigned to individuals and service accounts to validate the need for such privileges and reassign or remove unnecessary privileges, as necessary.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization periodically-review the privileges assigned to individuals and service accounts to validate the need for such privileges and reassign or remove unnecessary privileges, as necessary?'

label: IAC-18
content: 'User Responsibilities for Account Management - Mechanisms exist to compel users to follow accepted practices in the use of authentication mechanisms (e.g., passwords, passphrases, physical or logical security tokens, smart cards, certificates, etc.).; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization compel users to follow accepted practices in the use of authentication mechanisms (e.g., passwords, passphrases, physical or logical security tokens, smart cards, certificates, etc.)?'

label: IAC-19
content: 'Credential Sharing - Mechanisms exist to prevent the sharing of generic IDs, passwords or other generic authentication methods.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization prevent the sharing of generic IDs, passwords or other generic authentication methods?'

label: IAC-20
content: 'Access Enforcement - Mechanisms exist to enforce Logical Access Control (LAC) permissions that conform to the principle of "least privilege."; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization enforce Logical Access Control (LAC) permissions that conform to the principle of "least privilege?"'

label: IAC-20.1
content: 'Access To Sensitive / Regulated Data - Mechanisms exist to limit access to sensitive/regulated data to only those individuals whose job requires such access.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization limit access to sensitive/regulated data to only those individuals whose job requires such access?'

label: IAC-20.2
content: 'Database Access - Mechanisms exist to restrict access to databases containing sensitive/regulated data to only necessary services or those individuals whose job requires such access.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization restrict access to databases containing sensitive/regulated data to only necessary services or those individuals whose job requires such access?'

label: IAC-20.3
content: 'Use of Privileged Utility Programs - Mechanisms exist to restrict and tightly control utility programs that are capable of overriding system and application controls.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization restrict and tightly control utility programs that are capable of overriding system and application controls?'

label: IAC-20.4
content: 'Dedicated Administrative Machines - Mechanisms exist to restrict executing administrative tasks or tasks requiring elevated access to a dedicated machine.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization restrict executing administrative tasks or tasks requiring elevated access to a dedicated machine?'

label: IAC-20.5
content: 'Dual Authorization for Privileged Commands - Automated mechanisms exist to enforce dual authorization for privileged commands.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to enforce dual authorization for privileged commands?'

label: IAC-20.6
content: 'Revocation of Access Authorizations - Mechanisms exist to revoke logical and physical access authorizations.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization revoke logical and physical access authorizations?'

label: IAC-20.7
content: 'Authorized System Accounts - Mechanisms exist to define and document the types of accounts allowed and prohibited on systems, applications and services.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization define and document the types of accounts allowed and prohibited on systems, applications and services?'

label: IAC-21
content: 'Least Privilege - Mechanisms exist to utilize the concept of least privilege, allowing only authorized access to processes necessary to accomplish assigned tasks in accordance with organizational business functions.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization utilize the concept of least privilege, allowing only authorized access to processes necessary to accomplish assigned tasks in accordance with organizational business functions?'

label: IAC-21.1
content: 'Authorize Access to Security Functions - Mechanisms exist to limit access to security functions to explicitly-authorized privileged users.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization limit access to security functions to explicitly-authorized privileged users?'

label: IAC-21.2
content:
'Non-Privileged Access for Non-Security Functions - Mechanisms exist to prohibit privileged users from using privileged accounts, while performing non-security functions. 
; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization prohibit privileged users from using privileged accounts, while performing non-security functions? 
'

label: IAC-21.3
content: 'Privileged Accounts - Mechanisms exist to restrict the assignment of privileged accounts to management-approved personnel and/or roles.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization restrict the assignment of privileged accounts to management-approved personnel and/or roles?'

label: IAC-21.4
content: 'Auditing Use of Privileged Functions - Mechanisms exist to audit the execution of privileged functions.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization audit the execution of privileged functions?'

label: IAC-21.5
content: 'Prohibit Non-Privileged Users from Executing Privileged Functions - Mechanisms exist to prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions to include disabling, circumventing or altering implemented security safeguards / countermeasures.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions to include disabling, circumventing or altering implemented security safeguards / countermeasures?'

label: IAC-21.6
content: 'Network Access to Privileged Commands - Mechanisms exist to authorize remote access to perform privileged commands on critical systems or where sensitive/regulated data is stored, transmitted and/or processed only for compelling operational needs.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization authorize remote access to perform privileged commands on critical systems or where sensitive/regulated data is stored, transmitted and/or processed only for compelling operational needs?'

label: IAC-21.7
content: 'Privilege Levels for Code Execution - Automated mechanisms exist to prevent applications from executing at higher privilege levels than the user's privileges.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to prevent applications from executing at higher privilege levels than the user's privileges?'

label: IAC-22
content: 'Account Lockout - Mechanisms exist to enforce a limit for consecutive invalid login attempts by a user during an organization-defined time period and automatically locks the account when the maximum number of unsuccessful attempts is exceeded.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization enforce a limit for consecutive invalid login attempts by a user during an organization-defined time period and automatically locks the account when the maximum number of unsuccessful attempts is exceeded?'

label: IAC-23
content: 'Concurrent Session Control - Mechanisms exist to limit the number of concurrent sessions for each system account.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization limit the number of concurrent sessions for each system account?'

label: IAC-24
content: 'Session Lock - Mechanisms exist to initiate a session lock after an organization-defined time period of inactivity, or upon receiving a request from a user and retain the session lock until the user reestablishes access using established identification and authentication methods.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization initiate a session lock after an organization-defined time period of inactivity, or upon receiving a request from a user and retain the session lock until the user reestablishes access using established identification and authentication methods?'

label: IAC-24.1
content: 'Pattern-Hiding Displays - Mechanisms exist to implement pattern-hiding displays to conceal information previously visible on the display during the session lock.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization implement pattern-hiding displays to conceal information previously visible on the display during the session lock?'

label: IAC-25
content: 'Session Termination - Automated mechanisms exist to log out users, both locally on the network and for remote sessions, at the end of the session or after an organization-defined period of inactivity.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to log out users, both locally on the network and for remote sessions, at the end of the session or after an organization-defined period of inactivity?'

label: IAC-25.1
content: 'User-Initiated Logouts / Message Displays - Mechanisms exist to provide a logout capability and display an explicit logout message to users indicating the reliable termination of the session.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization provide a logout capability and display an explicit logout message to users indicating the reliable termination of the session?'

label: IAC-26
content: 'Permitted Actions Without Identification or Authorization - Mechanisms exist to identify and document the supporting rationale for specific user actions that can be performed on a system without identification or authentication.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization identify and document the supporting rationale for specific user actions that can be performed on a system without identification or authentication?'

label: IAC-27
content: 'Reference Monitor - Mechanisms exist to implement a reference monitor that is tamperproof, always-invoked, small enough to be subject to analysis / testing and the completeness of which can be assured.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization implement a reference monitor that is tamperproof, always-invoked, small enough to be subject to analysis / testing and the completeness of which can be assured?'

label: IAC-28
content: 'Identity Proofing (Identity Verification) - Mechanisms exist to verify the identity of a user before issuing authenticators or modifying access permissions.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization verify the identity of a user before issuing authenticators or modifying access permissions?'

label: IAC-28.1
content: 'Management Approval For New or Changed Accounts - Mechanisms exist to ensure management approvals are required for new accounts or changes in permissions to existing accounts.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization ensure management approvals are required for new accounts or changes in permissions to existing accounts?'

label: IAC-28.2
content: 'Identity Evidence - Mechanisms exist to require evidence of individual identification to be presented to the registration authority.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization require evidence of individual identification to be presented to the registration authority?'

label: IAC-28.3
content: 'Identity Evidence Validation & Verification - Mechanisms exist to require that the presented identity evidence be validated and verified through organizational-defined methods of validation and verification.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization require that the presented identity evidence be validated and verified through organizational-defined methods of validation and verification?'

label: IAC-28.4
