content: 'In-Person Validation & Verification - Mechanisms exist to require that the validation and verification of identity evidence be conducted in person before a designated registration authority.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization require that the validation and verification of identity evidence be conducted in person before a designated registration authority?'

label: IAC-28.5
content: 'Address Confirmation - Mechanisms exist to require that a notice of proofing be delivered through an out-of-band channel to verify the user's address (physical or digital).; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization require that a notice of proofing be delivered through an out-of-band channel to verify the user's address (physical or digital)?'

label: IAC-29
content: 'Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC) - Mechanisms exist to enforce Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC) for policy-driven, dynamic authorizations that supports the secure sharing of information.; Domain: Identification & Authentication; Questions: Does the organization enforce Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC) for policy-driven, dynamic authorizations that supports the secure sharing of information?'

label: IAO-01
content: 'Information Assurance (IA) Operations - Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of cybersecurity & data privacy assessment and authorization controls.; Domain: Information Assurance; Questions: Does the organization facilitate the implementation of cybersecurity & data privacy assessment and authorization controls?'

label: IAO-01.1
content: 'Assessment Boundaries - Mechanisms exist to establish the scope of assessments by defining the assessment boundary, according to people, processes and technology that directly or indirectly impact the confidentiality, integrity, availability and safety of the data and systems under review.; Domain: Information Assurance; Questions: Does the organization establish the scope of assessments by defining the assessment boundary, according to people, processes and technology that directly or indirectly impact the confidentiality, integrity, availability and safety of the data and systems under review?'

label: IAO-02
content: 'Assessments - Mechanisms exist to formally assess the cybersecurity & data privacy controls in systems, applications and services through Information Assurance Program (IAP) activities to determine the extent to which the controls are implemented correctly, operating as intended and producing the desired outcome with respect to meeting expected requirements.; Domain: Information Assurance; Questions: Does the organization formally assess the cybersecurity & data privacy controls in systems, applications and services through Information Assurance Program (IAP) activities to determine the extent to which the controls are implemented correctly, operating as intended and producing the desired outcome with respect to meeting expected requirements?'

label: IAO-02.1
content: 'Assessor Independence - Mechanisms exist to ensure assessors or assessment teams have the appropriate independence to conduct cybersecurity & data privacy control assessments.; Domain: Information Assurance; Questions: Does the organization ensure assessors or assessment teams have the appropriate independence to conduct cybersecurity & data privacy control assessments?'

label: IAO-02.2
IAO-02.3
content: 'Third-Party Assessments - Mechanisms exist to accept and respond to the results of external assessments that are performed by impartial, external organizations.; Domain: Information Assurance; Questions: Does the organization accept and respond to the results of external assessments that are performed by impartial, external organizations?'

label: IAO-02.4
content: 'Security Assessment Report (SAR) - Mechanisms exist to produce a Security Assessment Report (SAR) at the conclusion of a security assessment to certify the results of the assessment and assist with any remediation actions.; Domain: Information Assurance; Questions: Does the organization produce a Security Assessment Report (SAR) at the conclusion of a security assessment to certify the results of the assessment and assist with any remediation actions?'

label: IAO-03
content: 'System Security & Privacy Plan (SSPP) - Mechanisms exist to generate System Security & Privacy Plans (SSPPs), or similar document repositories, to identify and maintain key architectural information on each critical system, application or service, as well as influence inputs, entities, systems, applications and processes, providing a historical record of the data and its origins.; Domain: Information Assurance; Questions: Does the organization generate System Security & Privacy Plans (SSPPs), or similar document repositories, to identify and maintain key architectural information on each critical system, application or service, as well as influence inputs, entities, systems, applications and processes, providing a historical record of the data and its origins?'

label: IAO-03.1
content: 'Plan / Coordinate with Other Organizational Entities - Mechanisms exist to plan and coordinate Information Assurance Program (IAP) activities with affected stakeholders before conducting such activities in order to reduce the potential impact on operations.; Domain: Information Assurance; Questions: Does the organization plan and coordinate Information Assurance Program (IAP) activities with affected stakeholders before conducting such activities in order to reduce the potential impact on operations?'

label: IAO-03.2
content: 'Adequate Security for Sensitive / Regulated Data In Support of Contracts - Mechanisms exist to protect sensitive / regulated data that is collected, developed, received, transmitted, used or stored in support of the performance of a contract.; Domain: Information Assurance; Questions: Does the organization protect sensitive / regulated data that is collected, developed, received, transmitted, used or stored in support of the performance of a contract?'

label: IAO-04
content: 'Threat Analysis & Flaw Remediation During Development - Mechanisms exist to require system developers and integrators to create and execute a Security Testing and Evaluation (ST&E) plan, or similar process, to identify and remediate flaws during development.; Domain: Information Assurance; Questions: Does the organization require system developers and integrators to create and execute a Security Testing and Evaluation (ST&E) plan to identify and remediate flaws during development?'

label: IAO-05
content: 'Plan of Action & Milestones (POA&M) - Mechanisms exist to generate a Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M), or similar risk register, to document planned remedial actions to correct weaknesses or deficiencies noted during the assessment of the security controls and to reduce or eliminate known vulnerabilities.; Domain: Information Assurance; Questions: Does the organization generate a Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M), or similar risk register, to document planned remedial actions to correct weaknesses or deficiencies noted during the assessment of the security controls and to reduce or eliminate known vulnerabilities?'

label: IAO-05.1
content: 'Plan of Action & Milestones (POA&M) Automation - Automated mechanisms exist to help ensure the Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M), or similar risk register, is accurate, up-to-date and readily-available.; Domain: Information Assurance; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to help ensure the Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M), or similar risk register, is accurate, up-to-date and readily-available?'

label: IAO-06
content: 'Technical Verification - Mechanisms exist to perform Information Assurance Program (IAP) activities to evaluate the design, implementation and effectiveness of technical cybersecurity & data privacy controls.; Domain: Information Assurance; Questions: Does the organization perform Information Assurance Program (IAP) activities to evaluate the design, implementation and effectiveness of technical cybersecurity & data privacy controls?'

label: IAO-07
content: 'Security Authorization - Mechanisms exist to ensure systems, projects and services are officially authorized prior to "go live" in a production environment.; Domain: Information Assurance; Questions: Does the organization ensure systems, projects and services are officially authorized prior to "go live" in a production environment?'

label: IRO-01
content: 'Incident Response Operations - Mechanisms exist to implement and govern processes and documentation to facilitate an organization-wide response capability for cybersecurity & data privacy-related incidents.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization implement and govern processes and documentation to facilitate an organization-wide response capability for cybersecurity & data privacy-related incidents?'

label: IRO-02
IRO-02.1
content: 'Automated Incident Handling Processes - Automated mechanisms exist to support the incident handling process.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to support the incident handling process?'

label: IRO-02.2
content: 'Insider Threat Response Capability - Mechanisms exist to implement and govern an insider threat program.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization implement and govern an insider threat program?'

label: IRO-02.3
content: 'Dynamic Reconfiguration - Automated mechanisms exist to dynamically reconfigure information system components as part of the incident response capability.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to dynamically reconfigure information system components as part of the incident response capability?'

label: IRO-02.4
content: 'Incident Classification & Prioritization - Mechanisms exist to identify classes of incidents and actions to take to ensure the continuation of organizational missions and business functions.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization identify classes of incidents and actions to take to ensure the continuation of organizational missions and business functions?'

label: IRO-02.5
content: 'Correlation with External Organizations - Mechanisms exist to coordinate with approved third-parties to achieve a cross-organization perspective on incident awareness and more effective incident responses.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization coordinate with approved third-parties to achieve a cross-organization perspective on incident awareness and more effective incident responses?'

label: IRO-02.6
content: 'Automatic Disabling of System - Mechanisms exist to automatically disable systems, upon detection of a possible incident that meets organizational criteria, which allows for forensic analysis to be performed.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization automatically disable systems, upon detection of a possible incident that meets organizational criteria, which allows for forensic analysis to be performed?'

label: IRO-03
content: 'Indicators of Compromise (IOC) - Mechanisms exist to define specific Indicators of Compromise (IOC) to identify the signs of potential cybersecurity events.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization define specific Indicators of Compromise (IOC) to identify the signs of potential cybersecurity events?'

label: IRO-04
content: 'Incident Response Plan (IRP) - Mechanisms exist to maintain and make available a current and viable Incident Response Plan (IRP) to all stakeholders.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization maintain and make available a current and viable Incident Response Plan (IRP) to all stakeholders?'

label: IRO-04.1
content: 'Data Breach - Mechanisms exist to address data breaches, or other incidents involving the unauthorized disclosure of sensitive or regulated data, according to applicable laws, regulations and contractual obligations.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization address data breaches, or other incidents involving the unauthorized disclosure of sensitive or regulated data, according to applicable laws, regulations and contractual obligations?'

label: IRO-04.2
content: 'IRP Update - Mechanisms exist to regularly review and modify incident response practices to incorporate lessons learned, business process changes and industry developments, as necessary.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization regularly review and modify incident response practices to incorporate lessons learned, business process changes and industry developments, as necessary?'

label: IRO-04.3
content:
'Continuous Incident Response Improvements - Mechanisms exist to use qualitative and quantitative data from incident response testing to: 
 (1) Determine the effectiveness of incident response processes;
 (2) Continuously improve incident response processes; and
 (3) Provide incident response measures and metrics that are accurate, consistent, and in a reproducible format.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization use qualitative and quantitative data from incident response testing to: 
 (1) Determine the effectiveness of incident response processes;
 (2) Continuously improve incident response processes; and
 (3) Provide incident response measures and metrics that are accurate, consistent, and in a reproducible format?'

label: IRO-05
content: 'Incident Response Training - Mechanisms exist to train personnel in their incident response roles and responsibilities.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization train personnel in their incident response roles and responsibilities?'

label: IRO-05.1
content: 'Simulated Incidents - Mechanisms exist to incorporate simulated events into incident response training to facilitate effective response by personnel in crisis situations.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization incorporate simulated events into incident response training to facilitate effective response by personnel in crisis situations?'

label: IRO-05.2
content: 'Automated Incident Response Training Environments - Automated mechanisms exist to provide a more thorough and realistic incident response training environment.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to provide a more thorough and realistic incident response training environment?'

label: IRO-06
content: 'Incident Response Testing - Mechanisms exist to formally test incident response capabilities through realistic exercises to determine the operational effectiveness of those capabilities.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization formally test incident response capabilities through realistic exercises to determine the operational effectiveness of those capabilities?'

label: IRO-06.1
content: 'Coordination with Related Plans - Mechanisms exist to coordinate incident response testing with organizational elements responsible for related plans.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization coordinate incident response testing with organizational elements responsible for related plans?'

label: IRO-07
content: 'Integrated Security Incident Response Team (ISIRT) - Mechanisms exist to establish an integrated team of cybersecurity, IT and business function representatives that are capable of addressing cybersecurity & data privacy incident response operations.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization establish an integrated team of cybersecurity, IT and business function representatives that are capable of addressing cybersecurity & data privacy incident response operations?'

label: IRO-08
content: 'Chain of Custody & Forensics - Mechanisms exist to perform digital forensics and maintain the integrity of the chain of custody, in accordance with applicable laws, regulations and industry-recognized secure practices.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization perform digital forensics and maintain the integrity of the chain of custody, in accordance with applicable laws, regulations and industry-recognized secure practices?'

label: IRO-09
content: 'Situational Awareness For Incidents - Mechanisms exist to document, monitor and report the status of cybersecurity & data privacy incidents to internal stakeholders all the way through the resolution of the incident.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization document, monitor and report the status of cybersecurity & data privacy incidents to internal stakeholders all the way through the resolution of the incident?'

label: IRO-09.1
content: 'Automated Tracking, Data Collection & Analysis - Automated mechanisms exist to assist in the tracking, collection and analysis of information from actual and potential cybersecurity & data privacy incidents.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to assist in the tracking, collection and analysis of information from actual and potential cybersecurity & data privacy incidents?'

label: IRO-10
content:
'Incident Stakeholder Reporting - Mechanisms exist to timely-report incidents to applicable:
 (1) Internal stakeholders; 
 (2) Affected clients & third-parties; and
 (3) Regulatory authorities.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization timely-report incidents to applicable:
 (1) Internal stakeholders; 
 (2) Affected clients & third-parties; and
 (3) Regulatory authorities?'

label: IRO-10.1
content: 'Automated Reporting - Automated mechanisms exist to assist in the reporting of cybersecurity & data privacy incidents.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to assist in the reporting of cybersecurity & data privacy incidents?'

label: IRO-10.2
content: 'Cyber Incident Reporting for Sensitive / Regulated Data - Mechanisms exist to report sensitive/regulated data incidents in a timely manner.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization report sensitive/regulated data incidents in a timely manner?'

label: IRO-10.3
content: 'Vulnerabilities Related To Incidents - Mechanisms exist to report system vulnerabilities associated with reported cybersecurity & data privacy incidents to organization-defined personnel or roles.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization report system vulnerabilities associated with reported cybersecurity & data privacy incidents to organization-defined personnel or roles?'

label: IRO-10.4
content: 'Supply Chain Coordination - Mechanisms exist to provide cybersecurity & data privacy incident information to the provider of the product or service and other organizations involved in the supply chain for systems or system components related to the incident.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization provide cybersecurity & data privacy incident information to the provider of the product or service and other organizations involved in the supply chain for systems or system components related to the incident?'

label: IRO-11
content: 'Incident Reporting Assistance - Mechanisms exist to provide incident response advice and assistance to users of systems for the handling and reporting of actual and potential cybersecurity & data privacy incidents.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization provide incident response advice and assistance to users of systems for the handling and reporting of actual and potential cybersecurity & data privacy incidents?'

label: IRO-11.1
content: 'Automation Support of Availability of Information / Support - Automated mechanisms exist to increase the availability of incident response-related information and support.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to increase the availability of incident response-related information and support?'

label: IRO-11.2
content: 'Coordination With External Providers - Mechanisms exist to establish a direct, cooperative relationship between the organization's incident response capability and external service providers.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization establish a direct, cooperative relationship between its incident response capability and external service providers?'

label: IRO-12
content: 'Information Spillage Response - Mechanisms exist to respond to sensitive information spills.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization respond to sensitive information spills?'

label: IRO-12.1
content: 'Responsible Personnel - Mechanisms exist to formally assign personnel or roles with responsibility for responding to sensitive information spills.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization formally assign personnel or roles with responsibility for responding to sensitive information spills?'

label: IRO-12.2
content: 'Training - Mechanisms exist to ensure incident response training material provides coverage for sensitive information spillage response.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization ensure incident response training material provides coverage for sensitive information spillage response?'

label: IRO-12.3
content: 'Post-Spill Operations - Mechanisms exist to ensure that organizational personnel impacted by sensitive information spills can continue to carry out assigned tasks while contaminated systems are undergoing corrective actions.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization ensure that organizational personnel impacted by sensitive information spills can continue to carry out assigned tasks while contaminated systems are undergoing corrective actions?'

label: IRO-12.4
content: 'Exposure to Unauthorized Personnel - Mechanisms exist to address security safeguards for personnel exposed to sensitive information that is not within their assigned access authorizations.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization address security safeguards for personnel exposed to sensitive information that is not within their assigned access authorizations?'

label: IRO-13
content: 'Root Cause Analysis (RCA) & Lessons Learned - Mechanisms exist to incorporate lessons learned from analyzing and resolving cybersecurity & data privacy incidents to reduce the likelihood or impact of future incidents.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization incorporate lessons learned from analyzing and resolving cybersecurity & data privacy incidents to reduce the likelihood or impact of future incidents?'

label: IRO-14
content: 'Regulatory & Law Enforcement Contacts - Mechanisms exist to maintain incident response contacts with applicable regulatory and law enforcement agencies.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization maintain incident response contacts with applicable regulatory and law enforcement agencies?'

label: IRO-15
content: 'Detonation Chambers (Sandboxes) - Mechanisms exist to utilize a detonation chamber capability to detect and/or block potentially-malicious files and email attachments.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization utilize a detonation chamber capability to detect and/or block potentially-malicious files and email attachments?'

label: IRO-16
content: 'Public Relations & Reputation Repair - Mechanisms exist to proactively manage public relations associated with incidents and employ appropriate measures to prevent further reputational damage and develop plans to repair any damage to the organization's reputation.; Domain: Incident Response; Questions: Does the organization proactively manage public relations associated with incidents and employ appropriate measures to prevent further reputational damage and develop plans to repair any damage to its reputation?'

label: MDM-01
content: 'Centralized Management Of Mobile Devices - Mechanisms exist to implement and govern Mobile Device Management (MDM) controls.; Domain: Mobile Device Management; Questions: Does the organization implement and govern Mobile Device Management (MDM) controls?'

label: MDM-02
content: 'Access Control For Mobile Devices - Mechanisms exist to enforce access control requirements for the connection of mobile devices to organizational systems.; Domain: Mobile Device Management; Questions: Does the organization enforce access control requirements for the connection of mobile devices to organizational systems?'

label: MDM-03
content: 'Full Device & Container-Based Encryption - Cryptographic mechanisms exist to protect the confidentiality and integrity of information on mobile devices through full-device or container encryption.; Domain: Mobile Device Management; Questions: Are cryptographic mechanisms utilized to protect the confidentiality and integrity of information on mobile devices through full-device or container encryption?'

label: MDM-04
content: 'Mobile Device Tampering - Mechanisms exist to protect mobile devices from tampering through inspecting devices returning from locations that the organization deems to be of significant risk, prior to the device being connected to the organization's network.; Domain: Mobile Device Management; Questions: Does the organization protect mobile devices from tampering through inspecting devices returning from locations that the organization deems to be of significant risk, prior to the device being connected to its network?'

label: MDM-05
content: 'Remote Purging - Mechanisms exist to remotely purge selected information from mobile devices.; Domain: Mobile Device Management; Questions: Does the organization remotely purge selected information from mobile devices?'

label: MDM-06
content: 'Personally-Owned Mobile Devices - Mechanisms exist to restrict the connection of personally-owned, mobile devices to organizational systems and networks.; Domain: Mobile Device Management; Questions: Does the organization restrict the connection of personally-owned, mobile devices to organizational systems and networks?'

label: MDM-07
content: 'Organization-Owned Mobile Devices - Mechanisms exist to prohibit the installation of non-approved applications or approved applications not obtained through the organization-approved application store.; Domain: Mobile Device Management; Questions: Does the organization prohibit the installation of non-approved applications or approved applications not obtained through the organization-approved application store?'

label: MDM-08
content: 'Mobile Device Data Retention Limitations - Mechanisms exist to limit data retention on mobile devices to the smallest usable dataset and timeframe.; Domain: Mobile Device Management; Questions: Does the organization limit data retention on mobile devices to the smallest usable dataset and timeframe?'

label: MDM-09
content: 'Mobile Device Geofencing - Mechanisms exist to restrict the functionality of mobile devices based on geographic location.; Domain: Mobile Device Management; Questions: Does the organization restrict the functionality of mobile devices based on geographic location?'

label: MDM-10
content: 'Separate Mobile Device Profiles - Mechanisms exist to enforce a separate device workspace on applicable mobile devices to separate work-related and personal-related applications and data.; Domain: Mobile Device Management; Questions: Does the organization enforce a separate device workspace on applicable mobile devices to separate work-related and personal-related applications and data?'

label: MDM-11
content: 'Restricting Access To Authorized Devices - Mechanisms exist to restrict the connectivity of unauthorized mobile devices from communicating with systems, applications and services.; Domain: Mobile Device Management; Questions: Does the organization restrict the connectivity of unauthorized mobile devices from communicating with systems, applications and services?'

label: MNT-01
content: 'Maintenance Operations - Mechanisms exist to develop, disseminate, review & update procedures to facilitate the implementation of maintenance controls across the enterprise.; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization develop, disseminate, review & update procedures to facilitate the implementation of maintenance controls across the enterprise?'

label: MNT-02
content: 'Controlled Maintenance - Mechanisms exist to conduct controlled maintenance activities throughout the lifecycle of the system, application or service.; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization conduct controlled maintenance activities throughout the lifecycle of the system, application or service?'

label: MNT-02.1
content: 'Automated Maintenance Activities - Automated mechanisms exist to schedule, conduct and document maintenance and repairs.; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to schedule, conduct and document maintenance and repairs?'

label: MNT-03
content: 'Timely Maintenance - Mechanisms exist to obtain maintenance support and/or spare parts for systems within a defined Recovery Time Objective (RTO).; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization obtain maintenance support and/or spare parts for systems within a defined Recovery Time Objective (RTO)?'

label: MNT-03.1
content: 'Preventative Maintenance - Mechanisms exist to perform preventive maintenance on critical systems, applications and services.; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization perform preventive maintenance on critical systems, applications and services?'

label: MNT-03.2
content: 'Predictive Maintenance - Mechanisms exist to perform predictive maintenance on critical systems, applications and services.; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization perform predictive maintenance on critical systems, applications and services?'

label: MNT-03.3
content: 'Automated Support For Predictive Maintenance - Automated mechanisms exist to transfer predictive maintenance data to a computerized maintenance management system.; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to transfer predictive maintenance data to a computerized maintenance management system?'

label: MNT-04
content: 'Maintenance Tools - Mechanisms exist to control and monitor the use of system maintenance tools.; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization control and monitor the use of system maintenance tools?'

label: MNT-04.1
content: 'Inspect Tools - Mechanisms exist to inspect maintenance tools carried into a facility by maintenance personnel for improper or unauthorized modifications.; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization inspect maintenance tools carried into a facility by maintenance personnel for improper or unauthorized modifications?'

label: MNT-04.2
content: 'Inspect Media - Mechanisms exist to check media containing diagnostic and test programs for malicious code before the media are used.; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization check media containing diagnostic and test programs for malicious code before the media are used?'

label: MNT-04.3
content: 'Prevent Unauthorized Removal - Mechanisms exist to prevent or control the removal of equipment undergoing maintenance that containing organizational information.; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization prevent or control the removal of equipment undergoing maintenance that containing organizational information?'

label: MNT-04.4
content: 'Restrict Tool Usage - Automated mechanisms exist to restrict the use of maintenance tools to authorized maintenance personnel and/or roles.; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to restrict the use of maintenance tools to authorized maintenance personnel and/or roles?'

label: MNT-05
content: 'Remote Maintenance - Mechanisms exist to authorize, monitor and control remote, non-local maintenance and diagnostic activities.; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization authorize, monitor and control remote, non-local maintenance and diagnostic activities?'

label: MNT-05.1
content: 'Auditing Remote Maintenance - Mechanisms exist to audit remote, non-local maintenance and diagnostic sessions, as well as review the maintenance action performed during remote maintenance sessions.; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization audit remote, non-local maintenance and diagnostic sessions, as well as review the maintenance action performed during remote maintenance sessions?'

label: MNT-05.2
content: 'Remote Maintenance Notifications - Mechanisms exist to require maintenance personnel to notify affected stakeholders when remote, non-local maintenance is planned (e.g., date/time).; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization require maintenance personnel to notify affected stakeholders when remote, non-local maintenance is planned (e.g., date/time)?'

label: MNT-05.3
content: 'Remote Maintenance Cryptographic Protection - Cryptographic mechanisms exist to protect the integrity and confidentiality of remote, non-local maintenance and diagnostic communications.; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Are cryptographic mechanisms utilized to protect the integrity and confidentiality of remote, non-local maintenance and diagnostic communications?'

label: MNT-05.4
content: 'Remote Maintenance Disconnect Verification - Mechanisms exist to provide remote disconnect verification to ensure remote, non-local maintenance and diagnostic sessions are properly terminated.; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization provide remote disconnect verification to ensure remote, non-local maintenance and diagnostic sessions are properly terminated?'

label: MNT-05.5
content: 'Remote Maintenance Pre-Approval - Mechanisms exist to require maintenance personnel to obtain pre-approval and scheduling for remote, non-local maintenance sessions.; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization require maintenance personnel to obtain pre-approval and scheduling for remote, non-local maintenance sessions?'

label: MNT-05.6
content: 'Remote Maintenance Comparable Security & Sanitization - Mechanisms exist to require systems performing remote, non-local maintenance and / or diagnostic services implement a security capability comparable to the capability implemented on the system being serviced.; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization require systems performing remote, non-local maintenance and / or diagnostic services implement a security capability comparable to the capability implemented on the system being serviced?'

label: MNT-05.7
content: 'Separation of Maintenance Sessions - Mechanisms exist to protect maintenance sessions through replay-resistant sessions that are physically or logically separated communications paths from other network sessions.; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization protect maintenance sessions through replay-resistant sessions that are physically or logically separated communications paths from other network sessions?'

label: MNT-06
content: 'Authorized Maintenance Personnel - Mechanisms exist to maintain a current list of authorized maintenance organizations or personnel.; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization maintain a current list of authorized maintenance organizations or personnel?'

label: MNT-06.1
content: 'Maintenance Personnel Without Appropriate Access - Mechanisms exist to ensure the risks associated with maintenance personnel who do not have appropriate access authorizations, clearances or formal access approvals are appropriately mitigated.; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization ensure the risks associated with maintenance personnel who do not have appropriate access authorizations, clearances or formal access approvals are appropriately mitigated?'

label: MNT-06.2
content: 'Non-System Related Maintenance - Mechanisms exist to ensure that non-escorted personnel performing non-IT maintenance activities in the physical proximity of IT systems have required access authorizations.; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization ensure that non-escorted personnel performing non-IT maintenance activities in the physical proximity of IT systems have required access authorizations?'

label: MNT-07
content: 'Maintain Configuration Control During Maintenance - Mechanisms exist to maintain proper physical security and configuration control over technology assets awaiting service or repair.; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization maintain proper physical security and configuration control over technology assets awaiting service or repair?'

label: MNT-08
content: 'Field Maintenance - Mechanisms exist to securely conduct field maintenance on geographically deployed assets.; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization securely conduct field maintenance on geographically deployed assets?'

label: MNT-09
content: 'Off-Site Maintenance - Mechanisms exist to ensure off-site maintenance activities are conducted securely and the asset(s) undergoing maintenance actions are secured during physical transfer and storage while off-site.; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization ensure off-site maintenance activities are conducted securely and the asset(s) undergoing maintenance actions are secured during physical transfer and storage while off-site?'

label: MNT-10
content: 'Maintenance Validation - Mechanisms exist to validate maintenance activities were appropriately performed according to the work order and that security controls are operational.; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization validate maintenance activities were appropriately performed according to the work order and that security controls are operational?'

label: MNT-11
content: 'Maintenance Monitoring - Mechanisms exist to maintain situational awareness of the quality and reliability of systems and components through tracking maintenance activities and component failure rates.; Domain: Maintenance; Questions: Does the organization maintain situational awareness of the quality and reliability of systems and components through tracking maintenance activities and component failure rates?'

label: MON-01
content: 'Continuous Monitoring - Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of enterprise-wide monitoring controls.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization facilitate the implementation of enterprise-wide monitoring controls?'

label: MON-01.1
content: 'Intrusion Detection & Prevention Systems (IDS & IPS) - Mechanisms exist to implement Intrusion Detection / Prevention Systems (IDS / IPS) technologies on critical systems, key network segments and network choke points.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization implement Intrusion Detection / Prevention Systems (IDS / IPS) technologies on critical systems, key network segments and network choke points?'

label: MON-01.10
content: 'Deactivated Account Activity - Mechanisms exist to monitor deactivated accounts for attempted usage.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization monitor deactivated accounts for attempted usage?'

label: MON-01.11
content: 'Automated Response to Suspicious Events - Mechanisms exist to automatically implement pre-determined corrective actions in response to detected events that have security incident implications.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization automatically implement pre-determined corrective actions in response to detected events that have security incident implications?'

label: MON-01.12
content: 'Automated Alerts - Mechanisms exist to automatically alert incident response personnel to inappropriate or anomalous activities that have potential security incident implications.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization automatically alert incident response personnel to inappropriate or anomalous activities that have potential security incident implications?'

label: MON-01.13
content: 'Alert Threshold Tuning - Mechanisms exist to "tune" event monitoring technologies through analyzing communications traffic/event patterns and developing profiles representing common traffic patterns and/or events.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization "tune" event monitoring technologies through analyzing communications traffic/event patterns and developing profiles representing common traffic patterns and/or events?'

label: MON-01.14
content: 'Individuals Posing Greater Risk - Mechanisms exist to implement enhanced activity monitoring for individuals who have been identified as posing an increased level of risk.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization implement enhanced activity monitoring for individuals who have been identified as posing an increased level of risk?'

label: MON-01.15
content: 'Privileged User Oversight - Mechanisms exist to implement enhanced activity monitoring for privileged users.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization implement enhanced activity monitoring for privileged users?'

label: MON-01.16
content: 'Analyze and Prioritize Monitoring Requirements - Mechanisms exist to assess the organization's needs for monitoring and prioritize the monitoring of assets, based on asset criticality and the sensitivity of the data it stores, transmits and processes.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization assess its needs for monitoring and prioritize the monitoring of assets, based on asset criticality and the sensitivity of the data it stores, transmits and processes?'

label: MON-01.17
content: 'Real-Time Session Monitoring - Mechanisms exist to enable authorized personnel the ability to remotely view and hear content related to an established user session in real time, in accordance with organizational standards, as well as statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization enable authorized personnel the ability to remotely view and hear content related to an established user session in real time, in accordance with organizational standards, as well as statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations?'

label: MON-01.2
content: 'Automated Tools for Real-Time Analysis - Mechanisms exist to utilize a Security Incident Event Manager (SIEM), or similar automated tool, to support near real-time analysis and incident escalation.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization utilize a Security Incident Event Manager (SIEM), or similar automated tool, to support near real-time analysis and incident escalation?'

label: MON-01.3
content: 'Inbound & Outbound Communications Traffic - Mechanisms exist to continuously monitor inbound and outbound communications traffic for unusual or unauthorized activities or conditions.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization continuously monitor inbound and outbound communications traffic for unusual or unauthorized activities or conditions?'

label: MON-01.4
content: 'System Generated Alerts - Mechanisms exist to generate, monitor, correlate and respond to alerts from physical, cybersecurity, data privacy and supply chain activities to achieve integrated situational awareness.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization generate, monitor, correlate and respond to alerts from physical, cybersecurity, data privacy and supply chain activities to achieve integrated situational awareness?'

label: MON-01.5
content: 'Wireless Intrusion Detection System (WIDS) - Mechanisms exist to utilize Wireless Intrusion Detection / Protection Systems (WIDS / WIPS) to identify rogue wireless devices and to detect attack attempts via wireless networks.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization utilize Wireless Intrusion Detection / Protection Systems (WIDS / WIPS) to identify rogue wireless devices and to detect attack attempts via wireless networks?'

label: MON-01.6
content: 'Host-Based Devices - Mechanisms exist to utilize Host-based Intrusion Detection / Prevention Systems (HIDS / HIPS) to actively alert on or block unwanted activities and send logs to a Security Incident Event Manager (SIEM), or similar automated tool, to maintain situational awareness.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization utilize Host-based Intrusion Detection / Prevention Systems (HIDS / HIPS) to actively alert on or block unwanted activities and send logs to a Security Incident Event Manager (SIEM), or similar automated tool, to maintain situational awareness?'

label: MON-01.7
content: 'File Integrity Monitoring (FIM) - Mechanisms exist to utilize a File Integrity Monitor (FIM), or similar change-detection technology, on critical assets to generate alerts for unauthorized modifications.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization utilize a File Integrity Monitor (FIM), or similar change-detection technology, on critical assets to generate alerts for unauthorized modifications?'

label: MON-01.8
content: 'Security Event Monitoring - Mechanisms exist to review event logs on an ongoing basis and escalate incidents in accordance with established timelines and procedures.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization review event logs on an ongoing basis and escalate incidents in accordance with established timelines and procedures?'

label: MON-01.9
content: 'Proxy Logging - Mechanisms exist to log all Internet-bound requests, in order to identify prohibited activities and assist incident handlers with identifying potentially compromised systems.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization log all Internet-bound requests, in order to identify prohibited activities and assist incident handlers with identifying potentially compromised systems?'

label: MON-02
content: 'Centralized Collection of Security Event Logs - Mechanisms exist to utilize a Security Incident Event Manager (SIEM), or similar automated tool, to support the centralized collection of security-related event logs.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization utilize a Security Incident Event Manager (SIEM) or similar automated tool, to support the centralized collection of security-related event logs?'

label: MON-02.1
content: 'Correlate Monitoring Information - Automated mechanisms exist to correlate both technical and non-technical information from across the enterprise by a Security Incident Event Manager (SIEM) or similar automated tool, to enhance organization-wide situational awareness.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to correlate both technical and non-technical information from across the enterprise by a Security Incident Event Manager (SIEM) or similar automated tool, to enhance organization-wide situational awareness?'

label: MON-02.2
content: 'Central Review & Analysis - Automated mechanisms exist to centrally collect, review and analyze audit records from multiple sources.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to centrally collect, review and analyze audit records from multiple sources?'

label: MON-02.3
content: 'Integration of Scanning & Other Monitoring Information - Automated mechanisms exist to integrate the analysis of audit records with analysis of vulnerability scanners, network performance, system monitoring and other sources to further enhance the ability to identify inappropriate or unusual activity.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to integrate the analysis of audit records with analysis of vulnerability scanners, network performance, system monitoring and other sources to further enhance the ability to identify inappropriate or unusual activity?'

label: MON-02.4
content: 'Correlation with Physical Monitoring - Automated mechanisms exist to correlate information from audit records with information obtained from monitoring physical access to further enhance the ability to identify suspicious, inappropriate, unusual or malevolent activity.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to correlate information from audit records with information obtained from monitoring physical access to further enhance the ability to identify suspicious, inappropriate, unusual or malevolent activity?'

label: MON-02.5
content: 'Permitted Actions - Mechanisms exist to specify the permitted actions for both users and systems associated with the review, analysis and reporting of audit information.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization specify the permitted actions for both users and systems associated with the review, analysis and reporting of audit information?'

label: MON-02.6
content: 'Audit Level Adjustments - Mechanisms exist to adjust the level of audit review, analysis and reporting based on evolving threat information from law enforcement, industry associations or other credible sources of threat intelligence.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization adjust the level of audit review, analysis and reporting based on evolving threat information from law enforcement, industry associations or other credible sources of threat intelligence?'

label: MON-02.7
content: 'System-Wide / Time-Correlated Audit Trail - Automated mechanisms exist to compile audit records into an organization-wide audit trail that is time-correlated.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to compile audit records into an organization-wide audit trail that is time-correlated?'

label: MON-02.8
content: 'Changes by Authorized Individuals - Mechanisms exist to provide privileged users or roles the capability to change the auditing to be performed on specified information system components, based on specific event criteria within specified time thresholds.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization provide privileged users or roles the capability to change the auditing to be performed on specified information system components, based on specific event criteria within specified time thresholds?'

label: MON-03
MON-03.1
content: 'Sensitive Audit Information - Mechanisms exist to protect sensitive/regulated data contained in log files.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization protect sensitive/regulated data contained in log files?'

label: MON-03.2
content: 'Audit Trails - Mechanisms exist to link system access to individual users or service accounts.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization link system access to individual users or service accounts?'

label: MON-03.3
content: 'Privileged Functions Logging - Mechanisms exist to log and review the actions of users and/or services with elevated privileges.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization log and review the actions of users and/or services with elevated privileges?'

label: MON-03.4
content: 'Verbosity Logging for Boundary Devices - Mechanisms exist to verbosely log all traffic (both allowed and blocked) arriving at network boundary devices, including firewalls, Intrusion Detection / Prevention Systems (IDS/IPS) and inbound and outbound proxies.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization verbosely log all traffic (both allowed and blocked) arriving at network boundary devices, including firewalls, Intrusion Detection / Prevention Systems (IDS/IPS) and inbound and outbound proxies?'

label: MON-03.5
content: 'Limit Personal Data (PD) In Audit Records - Mechanisms exist to limit Personal Data (PD) contained in audit records to the elements identified in the data privacy risk assessment.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization limit Personal Data (PD) contained in audit records to the elements identified in the data privacy risk assessment?'

label: MON-03.6
content: 'Centralized Management of Planned Audit Record Content - Mechanisms exist to centrally manage and configure the content required to be captured in audit records generated by organization-defined information system components.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization centrally manage and configure the content required to be captured in audit records generated by organization-defined information system components?'

label: MON-03.7
content: 'Database Logging - Mechanisms exist to ensure databases produce audit records that contain sufficient information to monitor database activities.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization ensure databases produce audit records that contain sufficient information to monitor database activities?'

label: MON-04
content: 'Event Log Storage Capacity - Mechanisms exist to allocate and proactively manage sufficient event log storage capacity to reduce the likelihood of such capacity being exceeded.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization allocate and proactively manage sufficient event log storage capacity to reduce the likelihood of such capacity being exceeded?'

label: MON-05
content: 'Response To Event Log Processing Failures - Mechanisms exist to alert appropriate personnel in the event of a log processing failure and take actions to remedy the disruption.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization alert appropriate personnel in the event of a log processing failure and take actions to remedy the disruption?'

label: MON-05.1
content: 'Real-Time Alerts of Event Logging Failure - Mechanisms exist to provide 24x7x365 near real-time alerting capability when an event log processing failure occurs.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization provide 24x7x365 near real-time alerting capability when an event log processing failure occurs?'

label: MON-05.2
content: 'Event Log Storage Capacity Alerting - Automated mechanisms exist to alert appropriate personnel when the allocated volume reaches an organization-defined percentage of maximum event log storage capacity.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to alert appropriate personnel when the allocated volume reaches an organization-defined percentage of maximum event log storage capacity?'

label: MON-06
content: 'Monitoring Reporting - Mechanisms exist to provide an event log report generation capability to aid in detecting and assessing anomalous activities.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization provide an event log report generation capability to aid in detecting and assessing anomalous activities?'

label: MON-06.1
content: 'Query Parameter Audits of Personal Data (PD) - Mechanisms exist to provide and implement the capability for auditing the parameters of user query events for data sets containing Personal Data (PD).; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization provide and implement the capability for auditing the parameters of user query events for data sets containing Personal Data (PD)?'

label: MON-06.2
content: 'Trend Analysis Reporting - Mechanisms exist to employ trend analyses to determine if security control implementations, the frequency of continuous monitoring activities, and/or the types of activities used in the continuous monitoring process need to be modified based on empirical data.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization employ trend analyses to determine if security control implementations, the frequency of continuous monitoring activities, and/or the types of activities used in the continuous monitoring process need to be modified based on empirical data?'

label: MON-07
content: 'Time Stamps - Mechanisms exist to configure systems to use an authoritative time source to generate time stamps for event logs.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization configure systems to use an authoritative time source to generate time stamps for event logs?'

label: MON-07.1
content: 'Synchronization With Authoritative Time Source - Mechanisms exist to synchronize internal system clocks with an authoritative time source.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization synchronize internal system clocks with an authoritative time source?'

label: MON-08
content: 'Protection of Event Logs - Mechanisms exist to protect event logs and audit tools from unauthorized access, modification and deletion.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization protect event logs and audit tools from unauthorized access, modification and deletion?'

label: MON-08.1
content: 'Event Log Backup on Separate Physical Systems / Components - Mechanisms exist to back up event logs onto a physically different system or system component than the Security Incident Event Manager (SIEM) or similar automated tool.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization back up event logs onto a physically different system or system component than the Security Incident Event Manager (SIEM) or similar automated tool?'

label: MON-08.2
content: 'Access by Subset of Privileged Users - Mechanisms exist to restrict access to the management of event logs to privileged users with a specific business need.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization restrict access to the management of event logs to privileged users with a specific business need?'

label: MON-08.3
content: 'Cryptographic Protection of Event Log Information - Cryptographic mechanisms exist to protect the integrity of event logs and audit tools.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Are cryptographic mechanisms utilized to protect the integrity of event logs and audit tools?'

label: MON-08.4
content: 'Dual Authorization for Event Log Movement - Automated mechanisms exist to enforce dual authorization for the movement or deletion of event logs.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to enforce dual authorization for the movement or deletion of event logs?'

label: MON-09
content: 'Non-Repudiation - Mechanisms exist to utilize a non-repudiation capability to protect against an individual falsely denying having performed a particular action.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization utilize a non-repudiation capability to protect against an individual falsely denying having performed a particular action?'

label: MON-09.1
content: 'Identity Binding - Mechanisms exist to bind the identity of the information producer to the information generated.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization bind the identity of the information producer to the information generated?'

label: MON-10
content: 'Event Log Retention - Mechanisms exist to retain event logs for a time period consistent with records retention requirements to provide support for after-the-fact investigations of security incidents and to meet statutory, regulatory and contractual retention requirements.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization retain event logs for a time period consistent with records retention requirements to provide support for after-the-fact investigations of security incidents and to meet statutory, regulatory and contractual retention requirements?'

label: MON-11
content: 'Monitoring For Information Disclosure - Mechanisms exist to monitor for evidence of unauthorized exfiltration or disclosure of non-public information.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization monitor for evidence of unauthorized exfiltration or disclosure of non-public information?'

label: MON-11.1
content: 'Analyze Traffic for Covert Exfiltration - Automated mechanisms exist to analyze network traffic to detect covert data exfiltration.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to analyze network traffic to detect covert data exfiltration?'

label: MON-11.2
content: 'Unauthorized Network Services - Automated mechanisms exist to detect unauthorized network services and alert incident response personnel.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to detect unauthorized network services and alert incident response personnel?'

label: MON-11.3
content: 'Monitoring for Indicators of Compromise (IOC) - Automated mechanisms exist to identify and alert on Indicators of Compromise (IoC).; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to identify and alert on Indicators of Compromise (IoC)?'

label: MON-12
content:
'Session Audit - Mechanisms exist to provide session audit capabilities that can: 
 (1) Capture and log all content related to a user session; and
 (2) Remotely view all content related to an established user session in real time.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization provide session audit capabilities that can: 
 (1) Capture and log all content related to a user session; and
 (2) Remotely view all content related to an established user session in real time?'

label: MON-13
content: 'Alternate Event Logging Capability - Mechanisms exist to provide an alternate event logging capability in the event of a failure in primary audit capability.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization provide an alternate event logging capability in the event of a failure in primary audit capability?'

label: MON-14
content: 'Cross-Organizational Monitoring - Mechanisms exist to coordinate sanitized event logs among external organizations to identify anomalous events when event logs are shared across organizational boundaries, without giving away sensitive or critical business data.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization coordinate sanitized event logs among external organizations to identify anomalous events when event logs are shared across organizational boundaries, without giving away sensitive or critical business data?'

label: MON-14.1
content: 'Sharing of Event Logs - Mechanisms exist to share event logs with third-party organizations based on specific cross-organizational sharing agreements.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization share event logs with third-party organizations based on specific cross-organizational sharing agreements?'

label: MON-15
content: 'Covert Channel Analysis - Mechanisms exist to conduct covert channel analysis to identify aspects of communications that are potential avenues for covert channels.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization conduct covert channel analysis to identify aspects of communications that are potential avenues for covert channels?'

label: MON-16
content: 'Anomalous Behavior - Mechanisms exist to detect and respond to anomalous behavior that could indicate account compromise or other malicious activities.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization detect and respond to anomalous behavior that could indicate account compromise or other malicious activities?'

label: MON-16.1
content: 'Insider Threats - Mechanisms exist to monitor internal personnel activity for potential security incidents.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization monitor internal personnel activity for potential security incidents?'

label: MON-16.2
content: 'Third-Party Threats - Mechanisms exist to monitor third-party personnel activity for potential security incidents.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization monitor third-party personnel activity for potential security incidents?'

label: MON-16.3
content: 'Unauthorized Activities - Mechanisms exist to monitor for unauthorized activities, accounts, connections, devices and software.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization monitor for unauthorized activities, accounts, connections, devices and software?'

label: MON-16.4
content: 'Account Creation and Modification Logging - Automated mechanisms exist to generate event logs for permissions changes to privileged accounts and/or groups.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to generate event logs for permissions changes to privileged accounts and/or groups?'

label: MON-17
content: 'Event Log Analysis & Triage - Mechanisms exist to ensure event log reviews include analysis and triage practices that integrate with the organization's established incident response processes.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization ensure event log reviews include analysis and triage practices that integrate with its established incident response processes?'

label: MON-17.1
content: 'Event Log Review Escalation Matrix - Mechanisms exist to make event log review processes more efficient and effective by developing and maintaining an incident response escalation matrix.; Domain: Continuous Monitoring; Questions: Does the organization make event log review processes more efficient and effective by developing and maintaining an incident response escalation matrix?'

label: NET-01
content: 'Network Security Controls (NSC) - Mechanisms exist to develop, govern & update procedures to facilitate the implementation of Network Security Controls (NSC).; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization develop, govern & update procedures to facilitate the implementation of Network Security Controls (NSC)?'

label: NET-01.1
content: 'Zero Trust Architecture (ZTA) - Mechanisms exist to treat all users and devices as potential threats and prevent access to data and resources until the users can be properly authenticated and their access authorized.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization treat all users and devices as potential threats and prevent access to data and resources until the users can be properly authenticated and their access authorized?'

label: NET-02
content: 'Layered Network Defenses - Mechanisms exist to implement security functions as a layered structure that minimizes interactions between layers of the design and avoids any dependence by lower layers on the functionality or correctness of higher layers.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization implement security functions as a layered structure that minimizes interactions between layers of the design and avoids any dependence by lower layers on the functionality or correctness of higher layers?'

label: NET-02.1
content: 'Denial of Service (DoS) Protection - Automated mechanisms exist to protect against or limit the effects of denial of service attacks.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to protect against or limit the effects of denial of service attacks?'

label: NET-02.2
content: 'Guest Networks - Mechanisms exist to implement and manage a secure guest network.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization implement and manage a secure guest network?'

label: NET-02.3
content: 'Cross Domain Solution (CDS) - Mechanisms exist to implement a Cross Domain Solution (CDS) to mitigate the specific security risks of accessing or transferring information between security domains.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization implement a Cross Domain Solution (CDS) to mitigate the specific security risks of accessing or transferring information between security domains?'

label: NET-03
content: 'Boundary Protection - Mechanisms exist to monitor and control communications at the external network boundary and at key internal boundaries within the network.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization monitor and control communications at the external network boundary and at key internal boundaries within the network?'

label: NET-03.1
content: 'Limit Network Connections - Mechanisms exist to limit the number of concurrent external network connections to its systems.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization limit the number of concurrent external network connections to its systems?'

label: NET-03.2
content: 'External Telecommunications Services - Mechanisms exist to maintain a managed interface for each external telecommunication service that protects the confidentiality and integrity of the information being transmitted across each interface.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization maintain a managed interface for each external telecommunication service that protects the confidentiality and integrity of the information being transmitted across each interface?'

label: NET-03.3
content: 'Prevent Discovery of Internal Information - Mechanisms exist to prevent the public disclosure of internal network information.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization prevent the public disclosure of internal network information?'

label: NET-03.4
content: 'Personal Data (PD) - Mechanisms exist to apply network-based processing rules to data elements of Personal Data (PD).; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization apply network-based processing rules to data elements of Personal Data (PD)?'

label: NET-03.5
content: 'Prevent Unauthorized Exfiltration - Automated mechanisms exist to prevent the unauthorized exfiltration of sensitive/regulated data across managed interfaces.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to prevent the unauthorized exfiltration of sensitive/regulated data across managed interfaces?'

label: NET-03.6
content: 'Dynamic Isolation & Segregation (Sandboxing) - Automated mechanisms exist to dynamically isolate (e.g., sandbox) untrusted components during runtime, where the component is isolated in a fault-contained environment but it can still collaborate with the application.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to dynamically isolate (e.g., sandbox) untrusted components during runtime, where the component is isolated in a fault-contained environment but it can still collaborate with the application?'

label: NET-03.7
content: 'Isolation of Information System Components - Mechanisms exist to employ boundary protections to isolate systems, services and processes that support critical missions and/or business functions.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization employ boundary protections to isolate systems, services and processes that support critical missions and/or business functions?'

label: NET-03.8
content: 'Separate Subnet for Connecting to Different Security Domains - Mechanisms exist to implement separate network addresses (e.g., different subnets) to connect to systems in different security domains.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization implement separate network addresses (e.g., different subnets) to connect to systems in different security domains?'

label: NET-04
content: 'Data Flow Enforcement – Access Control Lists (ACLs) - Mechanisms exist to implement and govern Access Control Lists (ACLs) to provide data flow enforcement that explicitly restrict network traffic to only what is authorized.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization implement and govern Access Control Lists (ACLs) to provide data flow enforcement that explicitly restrict network traffic to only what is authorized?'

label: NET-04.1
content: 'Deny Traffic by Default & Allow Traffic by Exception - Mechanisms exist to configure firewall and router configurations to deny network traffic by default and allow network traffic by exception (e.g., deny all, permit by exception).; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization configure firewall and router configurations to deny network traffic by default and allow network traffic by exception (e.g., deny all, permit by exception)?'

label: NET-04.10
content: 'Detection of Unsanctioned Information - Automated mechanisms exist to implement security policy filters requiring fully enumerated formats that restrict data structure and content, when transferring information between different security domains.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to implement security policy filters requiring fully enumerated formats that restrict data structure and content, when transferring information between different security domains?'

label: NET-04.11
content: 'Approved Solutions - Automated mechanisms exist to examine information for the presence of unsanctioned information and prohibits the transfer of such information, when transferring information between different security domains.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to examine information for the presence of unsanctioned information and prohibits the transfer of such information, when transferring information between different security domains?'

label: NET-04.12
content: 'Cross Domain Authentication - Automated mechanisms exist to uniquely identify and authenticate source and destination points for information transfer.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to uniquely identify and authenticate source and destination points for information transfer?'

label: NET-04.13
content: 'Metadata Validation - Automated mechanisms exist to apply cybersecurity and/or data privacy filters on metadata.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to apply cybersecurity and/or data privacy filters on metadata?'

label: NET-04.14
content: 'Application Proxy - Mechanisms exist to terminate, inspect, control and reinitiate application traffic, regardless of the user’s location or the security posture of the surrounding network.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization maintain visibility and control over application traffic, regardless of the user’s location or the security posture of the surrounding network?'

label: NET-04.2
content: 'Object Security Attributes - Mechanisms exist to associate security attributes with information, source and destination objects to enforce defined information flow control configurations as a basis for flow control decisions.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization associate security attributes with information, source and destination objects to enforce defined information flow control configurations as a basis for flow control decisions?'

label: NET-04.3
content: 'Content Check for Encrypted Data - Mechanisms exist to prevent encrypted data from bypassing content-checking mechanisms.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization prevent encrypted data from bypassing content-checking mechanisms?'

label: NET-04.4
content: 'Embedded Data Types - Mechanisms exist to enforce limitations on embedding data within other data types.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization enforce limitations on embedding data within other data types?'

label: NET-04.5
content: 'Metadata - Mechanisms exist to enforce information flow controls based on metadata.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization enforce information flow controls based on metadata?'

label: NET-04.6
content: 'Human Reviews - Mechanisms exist to enforce the use of human reviews for Access Control Lists (ACLs) and similar rulesets on a routine basis.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization enforce the use of human reviews for Access Control Lists (ACLs) and similar rulesets on a routine basis?'

label: NET-04.7
content: 'Policy Decision Point (PDP) - Automated mechanisms exist to evaluate access requests against established criteria to dynamically and uniformly enforce access rights and permissions.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization evaluate access requests against established criteria to dynamically and uniformly enforce access rights and permissions?'

label: NET-04.8
content: 'Data Type Identifiers - Automated mechanisms exist to utilize data type identifiers to validate data essential for information flow decisions when transferring information between different security domains.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to utilize data type identifiers to validate data essential for information flow decisions when transferring information between different security domains?'

label: NET-04.9
content: 'Decomposition Into Policy-Related Subcomponents - Automated mechanisms exist to decompose information into policy-relevant subcomponents for submission to policy enforcement mechanisms, when transferring information between different security domains.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to decompose information into policy-relevant subcomponents for submission to policy enforcement mechanisms, when transferring information between different security domains?'

label: NET-05
content: 'Interconnection Security Agreements (ISAs) - Mechanisms exist to authorize connections from systems to other systems using Interconnection Security Agreements (ISAs), or similar methods, that document, for each interconnection, the interface characteristics, cybersecurity & data privacy requirements and the nature of the information communicated.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization authorize connections from systems to other systems using Interconnection Security Agreements (ISAs), or similar methods, that document, for each interconnection, the interface characteristics, cybersecurity & data privacy requirements and the nature of the information communicated?'

label: NET-05.1
content: 'External System Connections - Mechanisms exist to prohibit the direct connection of a sensitive system to an external network without the use of an organization-defined boundary protection device.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization prohibit the direct connection of a sensitive system to an external network without the use of an organization-defined boundary protection device?'

label: NET-05.2
content: 'Internal System Connections - Mechanisms exist to control internal system connections through authorizing internal connections of systems and documenting, for each internal connection, the interface characteristics, security requirements and the nature of the information communicated.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization control internal system connections through authorizing internal connections of systems and documenting, for each internal connection, the interface characteristics, security requirements and the nature of the information communicated?'

label: NET-06
content: 'Network Segmentation (macrosegementation) - Mechanisms exist to ensure network architecture utilizes network segmentation to isolate systems, applications and services that protections from other network resources.; Domain: Network Security; Questions: Does the organization ensure network architecture utilizes network segmentation to isolate systems, applications and services that protections from other network resources?'

label: NET-06.1
