content: 'Threat Intelligence Reporting - Mechanisms exist to utilize external threat intelligence feeds to generate and disseminate organization-specific security alerts, advisories and/or directives.; Domain: Threat Management; Questions: Does the organization utilize external threat intelligence feeds to generate and disseminate organization-specific security alerts, advisories and/or directives?'

label: THR-04
content: 'Insider Threat Program - Mechanisms exist to implement an insider threat program that includes a cross-discipline insider threat incident handling team.; Domain: Threat Management; Questions: Does the organization implement an insider threat program that includes a cross-discipline insider threat incident handling team?'

label: THR-05
content: 'Insider Threat Awareness - Mechanisms exist to utilize security awareness training on recognizing and reporting potential indicators of insider threat.; Domain: Threat Management; Questions: Does the organization utilize security awareness training on recognizing and reporting potential indicators of insider threat?'

label: THR-06
content: 'Vulnerability Disclosure Program (VDP) - Mechanisms exist to establish a Vulnerability Disclosure Program (VDP) to assist with the secure development and maintenance of products and services that receives unsolicited input from the public about vulnerabilities in organizational systems, services and processes.; Domain: Threat Management; Questions: Does the organization establish a Vulnerability Disclosure Program (VDP) to assist with the secure development and maintenance of products and services that receives unsolicited input from the public about vulnerabilities in organizational systems, services and processes?'

label: THR-06.1
content: 'Security Disclosure Contact Information - Mechanisms exist to enable public submissions of discovered or potential security vulnerabilities.; Domain: Threat Management; Questions: Does the organization enable public submissions of discovered or potential security vulnerabilities?'

label: THR-07
content: 'Threat Hunting - Mechanisms exist to perform cyber threat hunting that uses Indicators of Compromise (IoC) to detect, track and disrupt threats that evade existing security controls.; Domain: Threat Management; Questions: Does the organization perform cyber threat hunting that uses Indicators of Compromise (IoC) to detect, track and disrupt threats that evade existing security controls?'

label: THR-08
content: 'Tainting - Mechanisms exist to embed false data or steganographic data in files to enable the organization to determine if data has been exfiltrated and provide a means to identify the individual(s) involved.; Domain: Threat Management; Questions: Does the organization embed false data or steganographic data in files to enable the organization to determine if data has been exfiltrated and provide a means to identify the individual(s) involved?'

label: THR-09
content: 'Threat Catalog - Mechanisms exist to develop and keep current a catalog of applicable internal and external threats to the organization, both natural and manmade.; Domain: Threat Management; Questions: Does the organization develop and keep current a catalog of applicable internal and external threats to the organization, both natural and manmade?'

label: THR-10
content: 'Threat Analysis - Mechanisms exist to identify, assess, prioritize and document the potential impact(s) and likelihood(s) of applicable internal and external threats.; Domain: Threat Management; Questions: Does the organization identify, assess, prioritize and document the potential impact(s) and likelihood(s) of applicable internal and external threats?'

label: THR-11
content: 'Behavioral Baselining - Automated mechanisms exist to establish behavioral baselines that capture information about user and entity behavior to enable dynamic threat discovery.; Domain: Threat Management; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to establish behavioral baselines that capture information about user and entity behavior to enable dynamic threat discovery?'

label: TPM-01
content: 'Third-Party Management - Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of third-party management controls.; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization facilitate the implementation of third-party management controls?'

label: TPM-01.1
content: 'Third-Party Inventories - Mechanisms exist to maintain a current, accurate and complete list of External Service Providers (ESPs) that can potentially impact the Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability and/or Safety (CIAS) of the organization's systems, applications, services and data.; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization maintain a current, accurate and complete list of External Service Providers (ESPs) that can potentially impact the Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability and/or Safety (CIAS) of its systems, applications, services and data?'

label: TPM-02
content: 'Third-Party Criticality Assessments - Mechanisms exist to identify, prioritize and assess suppliers and partners of critical systems, components and services using a supply chain risk assessment process relative to their importance in supporting the delivery of high-value services.; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization identify, prioritize and assess suppliers and partners of critical systems, components and services using a supply chain risk assessment process relative to their importance in supporting the delivery of high-value services?'

label: TPM-03
content: 'Supply Chain Protection - Mechanisms exist to evaluate security risks associated with the services and product supply chain.; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization evaluate security risks associated with the services and product supply chain?'

label: TPM-03.1
content: 'Acquisition Strategies, Tools & Methods - Mechanisms exist to utilize tailored acquisition strategies, contract tools and procurement methods for the purchase of unique systems, system components or services.; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization utilize tailored acquisition strategies, contract tools and procurement methods for the purchase of unique systems, system components or services?'

label: TPM-03.2
content: 'Limit Potential Harm - Mechanisms exist to utilize security safeguards to limit harm from potential adversaries who identify and target the organization's supply chain.; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization utilize security safeguards to limit harm from potential adversaries who identify and target its supply chain?'

label: TPM-03.3
content: 'Processes To Address Weaknesses or Deficiencies - Mechanisms exist to address identified weaknesses or deficiencies in the security of the supply chain; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization address identified weaknesses or deficiencies in the security of the supply chain'

label: TPM-03.4
content: 'Adequate Supply - Mechanisms exist to develop and implement a spare parts strategy to ensure that an adequate supply of critical components is available to meet operational needs.; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization develop and implement a spare parts strategy to ensure that an adequate supply of critical components is available to meet operational needs?'

label: TPM-04
content: 'Third-Party Services - Mechanisms exist to mitigate the risks associated with third-party access to the organization's systems and data.; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization mitigate the risks associated with third-party access to its systems and data?'

label: TPM-04.1
content: 'Third-Party Risk Assessments & Approvals - Mechanisms exist to conduct a risk assessment prior to the acquisition or outsourcing of technology-related services.; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization conduct a risk assessment prior to the acquisition or outsourcing of technology-related services?'

label: TPM-04.2
content: 'External Connectivity Requirements - Identification of Ports, Protocols & Services - Mechanisms exist to require External Service Providers (ESPs) to identify and document the business need for ports, protocols and other services it requires to operate its processes and technologies.; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization require External Service Providers (ESPs) to identify and document the business need for ports, protocols and other services it requires to operate its processes and technologies?'

label: TPM-04.3
content: 'Conflict of Interests - Mechanisms exist to ensure that the interests of external service providers are consistent with and reflect organizational interests.; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization ensure that the interests of external service providers are consistent with and reflect organizational interests?'

label: TPM-04.4
content: 'Third-Party Processing, Storage and Service Locations - Mechanisms exist to restrict the location of information processing/storage based on business requirements.; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization restrict the location of information processing/storage based on business requirements?'

label: TPM-05
content: 'Third-Party Contract Requirements - Mechanisms exist to require contractual requirements for cybersecurity & data privacy requirements with third-parties, reflecting the organization's needs to protect its systems, processes and data.; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization require contractual requirements for cybersecurity & data privacy requirements with third-parties, reflecting its needs to protect its systems, processes and data?'

label: TPM-05.1
content: 'Security Compromise Notification Agreements - Mechanisms exist to compel External Service Providers (ESPs) to provide notification of actual or potential compromises in the supply chain that can potentially affect or have adversely affected systems, applications and/or services that the organization utilizes.; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization compel External Service Providers (ESPs) to provide notification of actual or potential compromises in the supply chain that can potentially affect or have adversely affected systems, applications and/or services that the organization utilizes?'

label: TPM-05.2
content: 'Contract Flow-Down Requirements - Mechanisms exist to ensure cybersecurity & data privacy requirements are included in contracts that flow-down to applicable sub-contractors and suppliers.; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization ensure cybersecurity & data privacy requirements are included in contracts that flow-down to applicable sub-contractors and suppliers?'

label: TPM-05.3
content: 'Third-Party Authentication Practices - Mechanisms exist to ensure External Service Providers (ESPs) use unique authentication factors for each of its customers.; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization ensure External Service Providers (ESPs) use unique authentication factors for each of its customers?'

label: TPM-05.4
content: 'Responsible, Accountable, Supportive, Consulted & Informed (RASCI) Matrix - Mechanisms exist to document and maintain a Responsible, Accountable, Supportive, Consulted & Informed (RASCI) matrix, or similar documentation, to delineate assignment for cybersecurity & data privacy controls between internal stakeholders and External Service Providers (ESPs).; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization document and maintain a Responsible, Accountable, Supportive, Consulted & Informed (RASCI) matrix, or similar documentation, to delineate assignment for cybersecurity & data privacy controls between internal stakeholders and External Service Providers (ESPs)?'

label: TPM-05.5
content: 'Third-Party Scope Review - Mechanisms exist to perform recurring validation of the Responsible, Accountable, Supportive, Consulted & Informed (RASCI) matrix, or similar documentation, to ensure cybersecurity & data privacy control assignments accurately reflect current business practices, compliance obligations, technologies and stakeholders.; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization perform recurring validation of the Responsible, Accountable, Supportive, Consulted & Informed (RASCI) matrix, or similar documentation, to ensure cybersecurity & data privacy control assignments accurately reflect current business practices, compliance obligations, technologies and stakeholders?'

label: TPM-05.6
content: 'First-Party Declaration (1PD) - Mechanisms exist to obtain a First-Party Declaration (1PD) from applicable External Service Providers (ESPs) that provides assurance of compliance with specified statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations for cybersecurity & data privacy controls, including any flow-down requirements to subcontractors.; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization obtain a First-Party Declaration (1PD) from applicable External Service Providers (ESPs) that provides assurance of compliance with specified statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations for cybersecurity & data privacy controls, including any flow-down requirements to subcontractors?'

label: TPM-05.7
content: 'Break Clauses - Mechanisms exist to include "break clauses" within contracts for failure to meet contract criteria for cybersecurity and/or data privacy controls.; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization include "break clauses" within contracts for failure to meet contract criteria for cybersecurity and/or data privacy controls?'

label: TPM-05.8
content: 'Third-Party Attestation (3PA) - Mechanisms exist to obtain an attestation from an independent Third-Party Assessment Organization (3PAO) that provides assurance of conformity with specified statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations for cybersecurity & data privacy controls, including any flow-down requirements to contractors and subcontractors.; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization obtain an attestation from an independent Third-Party Assessment Organization (3PAO) that provides assurance of conformity with specified statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations for cybersecurity & data privacy controls, including any flow-down requirements to contractors and subcontractors?'

label: TPM-06
content: 'Third-Party Personnel Security - Mechanisms exist to control personnel security requirements including security roles and responsibilities for third-party providers.; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization control personnel security requirements including security roles and responsibilities for third-party providers?'

label: TPM-07
content: 'Monitoring for Third-Party Information Disclosure - Mechanisms exist to monitor for evidence of unauthorized exfiltration or disclosure of organizational information.; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization monitor for evidence of unauthorized exfiltration or disclosure of organizational information?'

label: TPM-08
content: 'Review of Third-Party Services - Mechanisms exist to monitor, regularly review and assess External Service Providers (ESPs) for compliance with established contractual requirements for cybersecurity & data privacy controls.; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization monitor, regularly review and audit External Service Providers (ESPs) for compliance with established contractual requirements for cybersecurity & data privacy controls?'

label: TPM-09
content: 'Third-Party Deficiency Remediation - Mechanisms exist to address weaknesses or deficiencies in supply chain elements identified during independent or organizational assessments of such elements.; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization address weaknesses or deficiencies in supply chain elements identified during independent or organizational assessments of such elements?'

label: TPM-10
content: 'Managing Changes To Third-Party Services - Mechanisms exist to control changes to services by suppliers, taking into account the criticality of business information, systems and processes that are in scope by the third-party.; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization control changes to services by suppliers, taking into account the criticality of business information, systems and processes that are in scope by the third-party?'

label: TPM-11
content: 'Third-Party Incident Response & Recovery Capabilities - Mechanisms exist to ensure response/recovery planning and testing are conducted with critical suppliers/providers.; Domain: Third-Party Management; Questions: Does the organization ensure response/recovery planning and testing are conducted with critical suppliers/providers?'

label: VPM-01
content: 'Vulnerability & Patch Management Program (VPMP) - Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation and monitoring of vulnerability management controls.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization facilitate the implementation and monitoring of vulnerability management controls?'

label: VPM-01.1
content: 'Attack Surface Scope - Mechanisms exist to define and manage the scope for its attack surface management activities.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization define and manage the scope for its attack surface management activities?'

label: VPM-02
content: 'Vulnerability Remediation Process - Mechanisms exist to ensure that vulnerabilities are properly identified, tracked and remediated.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization ensure that vulnerabilities are properly identified, tracked and remediated?'

label: VPM-03
content: 'Vulnerability Ranking - Mechanisms exist to identify and assign a risk ranking to newly discovered security vulnerabilities using reputable outside sources for security vulnerability information.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization identify and assign a risk ranking to newly discovered security vulnerabilities using reputable outside sources for security vulnerability information?'

label: VPM-03.1
content: 'Vulnerability Exploitation Analysis - Mechanisms exist to identify, assess, prioritize and document the potential impact(s) and likelihood(s) of applicable internal and external threats exploiting known vulnerabilities.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization identify, assess, prioritize and document the potential impact(s) and likelihood(s) of applicable internal and external threats exploiting known vulnerabilities?'

label: VPM-04
content: 'Continuous Vulnerability Remediation Activities - Mechanisms exist to address new threats and vulnerabilities on an ongoing basis and ensure assets are protected against known attacks.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization address new threats and vulnerabilities on an ongoing basis and ensure assets are protected against known attacks?'

label: VPM-04.1
content: 'Stable Versions - Mechanisms exist to install the latest stable version of any software and/or security-related updates on all applicable systems.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization install the latest stable version of any software and/or security-related updates on all applicable systems?'

label: VPM-04.2
content: 'Flaw Remediation with Personal Data (PD) - Mechanisms exist to identify and correct flaws related to the collection, usage, processing or dissemination of Personal Data (PD).; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization identify and correct flaws related to the collection, usage, processing or dissemination of Personal Data (PD)?'

label: VPM-05
content: 'Software & Firmware Patching - Mechanisms exist to conduct software patching for all deployed operating systems, applications and firmware.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization conduct software patching for all deployed operating systems, applications and firmware?'

label: VPM-05.1
content: 'Centralized Management of Flaw Remediation Processes - Mechanisms exist to centrally-manage the flaw remediation process.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization centrally-manage the flaw remediation process?'

label: VPM-05.2
content: 'Automated Remediation Status - Automated mechanisms exist to determine the state of system components with regard to flaw remediation.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to determine the state of system components with regard to flaw remediation?'

label: VPM-05.3
content: 'Time To Remediate / Benchmarks For Corrective Action - Mechanisms exist to track the effectiveness of remediation operations through metrics reporting.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization track the effectiveness of remediation operations through metrics reporting?'

label: VPM-05.4
content: 'Automated Software & Firmware Updates - Automated mechanisms exist to install the latest stable versions of security-relevant software and firmware updates.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to install the latest stable versions of security-relevant software and firmware updates?'

label: VPM-05.5
content: 'Removal of Previous Versions - Mechanisms exist to remove old versions of software and firmware components after updated versions have been installed.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization remove old versions of software and firmware components after updated versions have been installed?'

label: VPM-05.6
content: 'Pre-Deployment Patch Testing - Mechanisms exist to perform due diligence on software and/or firmware update stability by conducting pre-production testing in a non-production environment.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization perform due diligence on software and/or firmware update stability by conducting pre-production testing in a non-production environment?'

label: VPM-05.7
content: 'Out-of-Cycle Patching - Mechanisms exist to perform out-of-cycle software and/or firmware updates to address time-sensitive remediations.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization perform out-of-cycle software and/or firmware updates to address time-sensitive remediations?'

label: VPM-06
content: 'Vulnerability Scanning - Mechanisms exist to detect vulnerabilities and configuration errors by routine vulnerability scanning of systems and applications.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization detect vulnerabilities and configuration errors by routine vulnerability scanning of systems and applications?'

label: VPM-06.1
content: 'Update Tool Capability - Mechanisms exist to update vulnerability scanning tools.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization update vulnerability scanning tools?'

label: VPM-06.2
content: 'Breadth / Depth of Coverage - Mechanisms exist to identify the breadth and depth of coverage for vulnerability scanning that define the system components scanned and types of vulnerabilities that are checked for.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization identify the breadth and depth of coverage for vulnerability scanning that define the system components scanned and types of vulnerabilities that are checked for?'

label: VPM-06.3
content: 'Privileged Access - Mechanisms exist to implement privileged access authorization for selected vulnerability scanning activities.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization implement privileged access authorization for selected vulnerability scanning activities?'

label: VPM-06.4
content: 'Trend Analysis - Automated mechanisms exist to compare the results of vulnerability scans over time to determine trends in system vulnerabilities.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to compare the results of vulnerability scans over time to determine trends in system vulnerabilities?'

label: VPM-06.5
content: 'Review Historical event logs - Mechanisms exist to review historical event logs to determine if identified vulnerabilities have been previously exploited.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization review historical event logs to determine if identified vulnerabilities have been previously exploited?'

label: VPM-06.6
content: 'External Vulnerability Assessment Scans - Mechanisms exist to perform quarterly external vulnerability scans (outside the organization's network looking inward) via a reputable vulnerability service provider, which include rescans until passing results are obtained or all “high” vulnerabilities are resolved, as defined by the Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS).; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization perform quarterly external vulnerability scans (outside its network looking inward) via a reputable vulnerability service provider, which include rescans until passing results are obtained or all “high” vulnerabilities are resolved, as defined by the Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS)?'

label: VPM-06.7
content: 'Internal Vulnerability Assessment Scans - Mechanisms exist to perform quarterly internal vulnerability scans, which includes all segments of the organization's internal network, as well as rescans until passing results are obtained or all “high” vulnerabilities are resolved, as defined by the Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS).; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization perform quarterly internal vulnerability scans, which includes all segments of its internal network, as well as rescans until passing results are obtained or all “high” vulnerabilities are resolved, as defined by the Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS)?'

label: VPM-06.8
content: 'Acceptable Discoverable Information - Mechanisms exist to define what information is allowed to be discoverable by adversaries and take corrective actions to remediated non-compliant systems.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization define what information is allowed to be discoverable by adversaries and take corrective actions to remediated non-compliant systems?'

label: VPM-06.9
content: 'Correlate Scanning Information - Automated mechanisms exist to correlate the output from vulnerability scanning tools to determine the presence of multi-vulnerability/multi-hop attack vectors.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization use automated mechanisms to correlate the output from vulnerability scanning tools to determine the presence of multi-vulnerability/multi-hop attack vectors?'

label: VPM-07
content: 'Penetration Testing - Mechanisms exist to conduct penetration testing on systems and web applications.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization conduct penetration testing on systems and web applications?'

label: VPM-07.1
content: 'Independent Penetration Agent or Team - Mechanisms exist to utilize an independent assessor or penetration team to perform penetration testing.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization utilize an independent assessor or penetration team to perform penetration testing?'

label: VPM-08
content: 'Technical Surveillance Countermeasures Security - Mechanisms exist to utilize a technical surveillance countermeasures survey.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization utilize a technical surveillance countermeasures survey?'

label: VPM-09
content: 'Reviewing Vulnerability Scanner Usage - Mechanisms exist to monitor logs associated with scanning activities and associated administrator accounts to ensure that those activities are limited to the timeframes of legitimate scans.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization monitor logs associated with scanning activities and associated administrator accounts to ensure that those activities are limited to the timeframes of legitimate scans?'

label: VPM-10
content: 'Red Team Exercises - Mechanisms exist to utilize "red team" exercises to simulate attempts by adversaries to compromise systems and applications in accordance with organization-defined rules of engagement.; Domain: Vulnerability & Patch Management; Questions: Does the organization utilize "red team" exercises to simulate attempts by adversaries to compromise systems and applications in accordance with organization-defined rules of engagement?'

label: WEB-01
content: 'Web Security - Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of an enterprise-wide web management policy, as well as associated standards, controls and procedures.; Domain: Web Security; Questions: Does the organization facilitate the implementation of an enterprise-wide web management policy, as well as associated standards, controls and procedures?'

label: WEB-01.1
content: 'Unauthorized Code - Mechanisms exist to prevent unauthorized code from being present in a secure page as it is rendered in a client’s browser.; Domain: Web Security; Questions: Does the organization prevent unauthorized code from being present in a secure page as it is rendered in a client’s browser?'

label: WEB-02
content: 'Use of Demilitarized Zones (DMZ) - Mechanisms exist to utilize a Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) to restrict inbound traffic to authorized devices on certain services, protocols and ports.; Domain: Web Security; Questions: Does the organization utilize a Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) to restrict inbound traffic to authorized devices on certain services, protocols and ports?'

label: WEB-03
content: 'Web Application Firewall (WAF) - Mechanisms exist to deploy Web Application Firewalls (WAFs) to provide defense-in-depth protection for application-specific threats.; Domain: Web Security; Questions: Does the organization deploy Web Application Firewalls (WAFs) to provide defense-in-depth protection for application-specific threats?'

label: WEB-04
content: 'Client-Facing Web Services - Mechanisms exist to deploy reasonably-expected security controls to protect the confidentiality and availability of client data that is stored, transmitted or processed by the Internet-based service.; Domain: Web Security; Questions: Does the organization deploy reasonably-expected security controls to protect the confidentiality and availability of client data that is stored, transmitted or processed by the Internet-based service?'

label: WEB-05
content: 'Cookie Management - Mechanisms exist to provide individuals with clear and precise information about cookies, in accordance with applicable legal requirements for cookie management.; Domain: Web Security; Questions: Does the organization provide individuals with clear and precise information about cookies, in accordance with applicable legal requirements for cookie management?'

label: WEB-06
content: 'Strong Customer Authentication (SCA) - Mechanisms exist to implement Strong Customer Authentication (SCA) for consumers to reasonably prove their identity.; Domain: Web Security; Questions: Does the organization implement Strong Customer Authentication (SCA) for consumers to reasonably prove their identity?'

label: WEB-07
content: 'Web Security Standard - Mechanisms exist to ensure the Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) Application Security Verification Standard is incorporated into the organization's Secure Systems Development Lifecycle (SSDLC) process.; Domain: Web Security; Questions: Does the organization ensure the Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) Application Security Verification Standard is incorporated into its Secure Systems Development Lifecycle (SSDLC) process?'

label: WEB-08
content: 'Web Application Framework - Mechanisms exist to ensure a robust Web Application Framework is used to aid in the development of secure web applications, including web services, web resources and web APIs.; Domain: Web Security; Questions: Does the organization ensure a robust Web Application Framework is used to aid in the development of secure web applications, including web services, web resources and web APIs?'

label: WEB-09
content: 'Validation & Sanitization - Mechanisms exist to ensure all input handled by a web application is validated and/or sanitized.; Domain: Web Security; Questions: Does the organization ensure all input handled by a web application is validated and/or sanitized?'

label: WEB-10
content: 'Secure Web Traffic - Mechanisms exist to ensure all web application content is delivered using cryptographic mechanisms (e.g., TLS).; Domain: Web Security; Questions: Does the organization ensure all web application content is delivered using cryptographic mechanisms (e.g., TLS)?'

label: WEB-11
content: 'Output Encoding - Mechanisms exist to ensure output encoding is performed on all content produced by a web application to reduce the likelihood of cross-site scripting and other injection attacks.; Domain: Web Security; Questions: Does the organization ensure output encoding is performed on all content produced by a web application to reduce the likelihood of cross-site scripting and other injection attacks?'

label: WEB-12
content: 'Web Browser Security - Mechanisms exist to ensure web applications implement Content-Security-Policy, HSTS and X-Frame-Options response headers to protect both the web application and its users.; Domain: Web Security; Questions: Does the organization ensure web applications implement Content-Security-Policy, HSTS and X-Frame-Options response headers to protect both the web application and its users?'

label: WEB-13
content: 'Website Change Detection - Mechanisms exist to detect and respond to Indicators of Compromise (IoC) for unauthorized alterations, additions, deletions or changes on websites that store, process and/or transmit sensitive / regulated data.; Domain: Web Security; Questions: Does the organization detect and respond to Indicators of Compromise (IoC) for unauthorized alterations, additions, deletions or changes on websites that store, process and/or transmit sensitive / regulated data?'

label: WEB-14
content: 'Publicly Accessible Content Reviews - Mechanisms exist to routinely review the content on publicly accessible systems for sensitive/regulated data and remove such information, if discovered.; Domain: Web Security; Questions: Does the organization routinely review the content on publicly accessible systems for sensitive/regulated data and remove such information, if discovered?'
